characters: ROY BLAND. TOBY ESTERHASE. PERCY ALLELINE. BILL HAYDON -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budapest skyline, looking towards the Parliament building From here the world looks serene, peaceful. Then, as we begin to PULL BACK, we hear a faint whine, increasing in volume, until it's the roar of two MiG jet fighters, cutting across the skyline. The PULL BACK reveals a YOUNG BOY watching the jets, exclaiming excitedly in Hungarian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATERALLY TRACKING down a bustling street, as the jets scream by overhead. Pedestrians look up. All except one m who continues walking. This is JIM PRIDEAUX. ACROSS THE STREET: More pedestrians. We're not sure who we're supposed to be looking at - the short stocky man? T girl in the mini skirt? The man in the checked jacket? A car driving beside Prideaux accelerates out of the fram Across the street the girl in the mini-skirt peels off in a shop. The stocky man turns and waves to us. But it isn' Prideaux he's greeting but another passerby, who walks over, shakes hands. Now we're left with Prideaux and the Magyar in the checke shirt, neither paying any attention to each other. Just as we are wondering if there is any connection, the two reach a corner and the Magyar, pausing to cross the road, collides with another passerby. He looks over and sees Prideaux has caught the moment of slight clumsiness and gives the smallest of rueful smiles. A tiny moment of contact between the two. Then both men walk on around the corner, just two strangers headed in the same direction..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting up the steps of the exit to the imposing GALERIA building on the corner ahead. Prideaux and the Magyar wal up the steps, still paying no attention to each other, an head towards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A formerly grand arcade. Many of the shops are now closed the one's that are open don't have much to sell. A CAFE occupies the middle space under the high vaulted ceiling. JAZZ ROCK band rehearses in one of the nearby disused shops, incongruous in the window, music muffled by the glass. Customers sit around tables playing chess, drinkin coffee, a mother breast-feeding, the hum of chatter. The ordinary world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find Prideaux and the Magyar sitting at one of the tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Hungarian, subtitled) And porkolts. You know porkolts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Hungarian, subtitled) Yes, I've had it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very good. Better than goulash. But you won't get it in Budapest now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the pigs have gone to Moscow. He gives a sly laugh. Prideaux smiles, draws   on his cigarette, nonchalantly examining the people   at the tab around them. A WAITER arrives, belly bulging   out of his grubby shirt, hair plastered to his head. He   puts two wizened-looking sandwiches in front of them. PRIDEAUX'S P.O.V. - A DROP OF SWEAT trickles from the Waiter's face, drips onto the table top. The Magyar catches Jim looking at the droplet and gives a wry smile - "nice service." Jim smiles back but a bell ha begun to ring inside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do I get to meet your friend? The Magyar chews on his sandwich, notices Prideaux is ignoring his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take you to him. Not eating? Prideaux pushes his sandwich across the table, his manner still easy, but his eyes flick after the Waiter, who stan at the entrance to the coffee shop, arguing with another man. He looks around the Galeria again, looking low - checking the feet of the other customers? Then raising hi gaze, he checks the windows of the apartments above which look down into the arcade. PRIDEAUX'S P.O.V. - An OLD WOMAN stands in the shadows by window above. She is watching him. Catching his gaze she shrinks back into the darkness and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prideaux's expression doesn't change but he sets his coff cup down and casually stands. The Magyar looks up in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you excuse me a moment? He starts to walk towards the exit of the Galeria. Behind him his chair teeters for a moment, then slowly falls bac and lands with a CRASH, sending pigeons fluttering up to the domed ceiling. The WAITER starts, turns, sees Prideaux leaving. Panic flashes across his face, he draws a GUN from the back of his belt, aims after Prideaux and FIRES - the shot echoin in the cavernous space. The shot misses, RICOCHETING off the tiled wall and Prideaux keeps walking, fighting down the impulse to run, as behind him, out of focus - an image from a surreal NIGHTMARE: the other CUSTOMERS stop what they are doing, like actors at the end of a scene, and begin to rise, som drawing guns. We hear a muffled voice shouting distantly Russian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No firing! Ahead of Prideaux   more figures appear, blocking the exi He looks over his   shoulder just as another SHOT rings o this one catching   him above the shoulder blade and send him flying out of   frame. From around a corner a tall, over-coated man - KGB - strides towards the scene, still bellowing in Russian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you to fire? Who told you to fucking fire? THE JAZZ BAND have stopped playing and are staring at the ground, arms at their sides, anxious not to see anything. In the TOP WINDOW - the OLD WOMAN slips back into sight. HER P.O.V. - Prideaux lies face down in the arcade below. As we watch one of his arms slides out, leaving a slick o blood. Then he's still. BELOW - The KGB Man has grabbed the Waiter and started to beat him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking Hungarian amateur! We wanted him alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him we can see the breast-feeding MOTHER. She's dead, a bullet hole in the centre of her forehead from th ricochet. The baby continues to suckle on, undisturbed. Through the cafe window we can see a MAN, partly obscured by the crowd in front of us, the only man still seated. H lights a cigarette. CLOSE ON THE LIGHTER as he replaces it. We can make out a inscription: "To George, from Ann. All my love." In the Galeria the KGB Man continues to bellow at the Waiter. The baby begins to WAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bird's eye view of the Circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman, CONNIE SACHS, a face that's seen it all, leans against a wall, smoking. A middle-aged woman, one of the secretaries or "MOTHERS" walks past, pushing a trolley of documents. She nods at Connie mournfully. Connie looks stricken. The Mother walks on into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long conference table. We are looking at an ELDERLY MAN at the head of the table. He's sitting on a rather ornate carving chair - a little like a throne - and he looks ill He is signing documents, his signature a simple "C," scrawled in GREEN INK, aware all eyes are on him. A cigarette burns away in an already loaded ashtray. This is the head of the Circus - known as CONTROL. Around him are four lieutenants - the inner circle of the intelligence service - PERCY ALLELINE, TOBY ESTERHASE, RO BLAND and BILL HAYDON. Beside him, his right-hand man - GEORGE SMILEY. From the thick and embarrassed atmosphere we might guess are at the end of a coup, the final ousting of a King. Al we hear is the ticking of a loud clock and the scratch of the pen. Smiley looks up to find Alleline's gaze fixed on him. Alleline quickly looks down at his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON SMILEY - as he examines the others, gauging the SHIFT OF POWER occurring in the room. - Bill Haydon - handsome, urbane, frowning with tension, pulls on his cigarette. - Roy Bland - heavy set and moustached, flicking a guilty look up at Smiley and away. - Toby Esterhase - immaculate hair and suit, eyes on Alleline, watching for a cue, like a dog told to `stay'. No-one will look at him. ON SMILEY - realising there is no hope. Control finishes, puts the pen back in his pocket. He han the file to the MOTHER who, red-eyed, walks with it out o the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Scottish accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could have done more, Control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Coolly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did all you could, Percy. (Beat) Well, a man should know when to leave the party. Beat. The clock suddenly gives a discordant chime as it sounds the hour. A hint of bitter amusement on Control's face, as though he's been waiting for this wrong little note to make his move. He grinds his cigarette out. Toby can't wait any longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Smiley? Control looks at Smiley. His gaze impersonal... ON SMILEY - the faintest flicker in his eyes as he tries prepare himself for the shock of dismissal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley is leaving with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSHING Control and Smiley as they walk down the corridor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alleline and the Lieutenants are waiting for them. A horribly awkward moment. Toby pulls open the cage lift doors for them, as if to hasten the eviction. Haydon look at him with contempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little prick Esterhase. Control sweeps past them and the lift, determined to walk every step of the way. Smiley follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control and Smiley, begin their descent through the rigid hierarchy of the Circus. As we TRACK with them, we see th each floor is its own WORLD. The two men walk past the fourth floor REGISTRY - the vast archive of intelligence, staffed by RESEARCHERS. Smiley and Control pass down another flight and along the third floor - INTELLIGENCE OFFICERS - heads poking out of offices, amongst them JERRY WESTERBY. Down to the second floor - SCALPHUNTERS - the muscle of t Circus. The boredom of an air-port lounge, a sunken sofa and pool-table. The Scalphunters watching them go in respectful silence. On down to the first floor TYPING POOL - staffed by prett young society girls - the DEBS - who watch open-mouthed, their Chief passes them for the last time. And finally down to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ancient doorman - BRYANT - feeling the moment must be marked in some way - leaves his sentry box and opens the main door for Control. Control acknowledges the salute wi a flick of his eyes and we push through the doors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alleline and Bland stand smoking, watching Control and Smiley emerge onto the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTROL and SMILEY stand on the street. They stare at eac other for a moment. This is goodbye. They shake hands. Perhaps there's a little reserve in Control's manner, a lack of warmth. From the expression on Smiley's face we s that he is pained by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control puts his collar up and walks away. Smiley stands forlornly as Control disappears into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WATER OF THE POND - still, glassy. A MAN'S head breaks the surface - Smiley swimming through his retirement. He takes a breath and submerges again. Beyond him we see straggled diagonal line of elderly heads, bobbing through the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley dries himself under the trees, pink and raw in the cold fresh air. He smooths his hair down, feeling a littl less ridiculous. He looks over to where a VERY ELDERLY SWIMMER is being helped into the water - little more than trembling bones. Is this his world now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOTHER unloads a stack of files from a LIFT shaft and places them into her wheeled safe. A piece of CHRISTMAS TINSEL is wound along the trolley. We track with her through the HIVE-LIKE atmosphere of the fifth floor, behi her the conference room - a glimpse of Alleline in Control's chair, surrounded by his lieutenants - smoke an whiskey - engaged in the business of the world. She pushes on into Alleline's OFFICE - loads the new file into the LARGE SAFE there, locks and spins the combinatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley stands frying an egg in his small kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley sits eating his solitary lunch, reading a volume o Grimmelshausen. He turns a page, examines the illustratio of a knight and a dragon - holds it at arms length, tryin to focus on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley lies in the double bed, a conspicuous empty space to him. He leans over and turns the light out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND removes files from the LARGE SAFE. ON A BRIEFCASE - as the files - marked TOP SECRET - are slipped inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... TRACKING through the near-empty offices. All the drawers of the desks are OPEN. BINS on the tables. A few mothers working late, illuminated by their desk lamps. On of them is applying lipstick, prior to leaving. She doesn react as we track by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking at large blurred LETTERS. A lens is slotte into our frame and the letters leap into BOLD. Smiley is in a chair, being fitted for spectacles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley is selecting frames from a display. He tries on a pair, watched by a bored shop assistant, used to the pedantic ways of the retired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING with the BRIEFCASE as the mystery man walks towards the main entrance. The ELDERLY PORTER- BRYANT - nods respectfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A packed train - Businessmen in bowler hats, long-haired seventies youth - the old and the new bumping underneath the city. We track low level until we find our MYSTERY MA the BRIEFCASE clutched in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking with the BRIEFCASE as it is carried towards the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elderly lady - MRS McCRAIG - stands at the sink. Throu the window she catches a glimpse of the Mystery Man's leg passing, the briefcase in his hand as he walks up the ste towards the front door. Calmly she dries her hands as the doorbell rings and her DOG begins to bark furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs McCraig opens the door and the figure passes her and the barking dog without a word and begins to walk up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley adds a LETTER to a pile on the mantelpiece. We see the letters are all addressed to ANN SMILEY. He straightens up, finds himself staring at a PAINTING on the wall - a muddy abstract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is almost bare - two chairs at a small table on which stands two desk lamps and a CAMERA. The Mystery Man has crossed to the wall by the window and opens the GRILL on an AIR DUCT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From across the street a tall good-looking man - POLYAKOV watches as the opened duct spills a star pattern of light out into the night air. He walks towards the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mystery man settles at the table, sorting through the contents of the briefcase as, from down below, we hear th sound of the door bell, the dog barking and footsteps on the stairs. Polyakov walks into the room and joins the Mystery Man at the small table. He picks up the camera wi a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we begin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights glowing in the early morning gloom, an ultra-moder cube of a building sits in rather traditional grounds. Th is the unlikely home of Oliver Lacon, Permanent under- secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we watch a young girl - JACKIE LACON - appears at the living room window in her night-dress, playing with a toy we watch her we hear stealthy footsteps approach. Then a steps into frame, his back to us, watching the girl throu the window. He taps on the glass with one hand. Jackie lo up, surprised. As we pull back a little we see the man has his other han behind his back. And in it is a long, bone-handled KNIFE. Behind Jackie we see a string bean of a man, OLIVER LACON tying his silk dressing gown as he cautiously approaches window. On the other side, the intruder stands, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through glass) This is private property. Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes in the man before him - filthy and bearded, you could mistake him for a tramp. But beneath the grime he's tanned and his eyes have a dangerous, feral edge. This is RICKI TARR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minister Lacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to Control. And I want breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER GUILLAM walks down a corridor. Handsome, boyish, bored. He hears a TRING behind him. It's Haydon, one foot up on his pedal, scootering along the corridor. Guillam waits for him. He likes this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of the bike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has that been cleared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not bloody chaining it outside. Mind you, probably no safer in here, with you bunch of cut-throats. They arrive at a half-paned office cubicle. Inside is a very pretty GIRL, a new DEB, being shown the ropes by an older woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought I'd get a glimpse of the new girl. Before Bland gets to her. He seen her yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes. Down first thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... as Haydon and Guillam pass, staring in at her, croppe above the waist. Haydon appears to be gliding supernaturally by. He gives a little wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may fuck me, Belinda, but you still have to call me sir in the morning. Guillam grins. Haydon glides off, hand raised in farewell as Guillam turns into the Scalphunters arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam sits at his desk over a pile of paper-work, slowl falling asleep. BANG! A pool ball thwacks the window, cracking it. At the same moment the PHONE begins to ring. Guillam jerks upright, looks over at the pool players, too bored to be angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Peter. Guillam answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter Guillam... He listens to the voice on the other end. After a moment turns away from his colleagues, his former drowsiness abruptly gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley in his NEW GLASSES, towel rolled under his arm, walking down the street. He stops for a moment, feeling himself watched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley on the steps to his home, stops, examines the door removing a WEDGE from the top of the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley walks into the hallway, stopping to pick up post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley places the wedge and the letters on the mantelpiec where a BUNDLE of LETTERS already sits, addressed to ANN SMILEY. Unopened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley frying an egg. There's a knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley opens the door to PETER GUILLAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Peter. They stare at each other. Smiley takes in his expression this is not a social call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I time to change? Guillam nods, following Smiley into the house. He glances a painting on the wall - a muddy ABSTRACT. He crosses to examine it and then notices the bundle of Ann's unopened letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam enters the kitchen, notes the single place set fo dinner. It dawns on him that he really has invaded Smiley privacy. Smiley appears in a coat behind him, taking in Guillam's awkwardness. He gives a thin smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley and Guillam sit in silence, as Guillam drives thro London. It's a Citroen DS, all sleek leather and mahogany interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half eaten bacon SANDWICH, sitting on a table. We pan up and through the open window see an anxious Laco leading Guillam towards the house. Smiley follows, talkin Lacon's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. (referring to the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this where he got out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm, I came back in and it was wide open. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do send her my love. Apologies for singling you out, but... very sensitive matter... He gives an uncomfortable bark of laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If one can't trust one's own nephew... You know who he was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricki Tarr, sir. One of my scalp- hunters. He's been on the wanted list for a year. Last job was Istanbul, bit of coat-trailing for a Russian convention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he on the wanted list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed our man in Istanbul. Cut his throat. Been on the run since then. If possible, Lacon looks even more shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God. In my own home... my family... The bloody animals you people employ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULLING OLIVER LACON as he leads Smiley and Guillam down the hall, gesturing for his WIFE to take Jackie away. He attempts some social niceties, but his tone is strained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how are you George? Missing one's work, one's buddies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I think I manage pretty well, thank you. They reach a large room, minimalist apart from a grand pi framed by vast glass windows. A tall, well built young ma FAWN - stands on guard. Lacon gestures to him and Fawn op the french windows and he and Guillam walk out onto the terrace beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, unnoticed, young JACKIE creeps back into the room and slips behind the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife, the lovely Ann? She's in the pink, and so on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. (Beat) Very bonny... Fawn closes the french doors behind him and Lacon is sudd all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know this man Tarr?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mildly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I recruited him actually. In Penang. Good with women. Likes to talk. What did he say to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he had some intelligence for Control. Had no idea he was dead. The news obviously hadn't reached Wonga Wonga land. Then he said he would only tell it to someone outside the Circus. If he couldn't have a Minister, he would settle for the Under-secretary. Lucky me. Lacon lights a cigarette, smokes a moment, building up to something. Smiley waits him out. The room has become very still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said there's a mole. Right at the top of the Circus. And that he's been there for years. Smiley absorbs this. The moment is suddenly broken by a f stray notes from the piano. The two jump slightly and tur where Jackie sits at the keyboard, smiling triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley and Lacon stand on the terrace alone. Lacon glance anxiously at Smiley, trying to read him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sad to see you go, George. I thought it was shabby, very shabby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LACON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Minister agreed with Sir Percy. New broom, clean sweep, wheat from the chaff and all that. And to be fair, Percy has had some marvellous results since you and Control left... Realizing how this sounds, he glances at Smiley to see ho much damage he's caused. LACON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, it does mean you're rather ideally placed to look into this matter for us now, doesn't it? Outside the family? Smiley looks blandly back at him. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am retired, Oliver. Silence. Lacon looks uncomfortable, something he hasn't y said. LACON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing is, some time back, when Control was still alive, he came to me with a similar suggestion. Smiley looks at him, surprised. LACON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never mentioned his suspicions to you? SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. LACON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought... with you being "his man", so to speak. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say to him? LACON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat) I'm afraid I thought his paranoia had got the better of him and he was pulling his own house down. That does happen in your business. And that bloody mess in Budapest... Smiley stares out over the rolling countryside, inscrutab LACON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, George, this is your generation, your legacy! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's any truth in this you'd think you'd want to... He controls himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep Peter Guillam. And there's a retired special branch man. Mendel. I'd like to have him. Lacon exhales, his relief palpable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. Do your own housekeeping. Good man. He glances back at Guillam and Lacon's daughter, picking a melody on the grand piano.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn thing cost a fortune. Three years of lessons and all I hear is Edelweiss. You and Ann never had children, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we never did. We hear the piano playing on as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... driving through suburban DAGENHAM. We pull up in fron of a neat Tudor semi.

dialogues.speaker: A COLONY OF BEES
dialogues.text: GLOVED HANDS loading a COLONY OF BEES into a new HIVE. An APIARIST, in protective hat and gloves, turns to exami the MAN who has appeared in his back yard - GEORGE SMILEY Smiley raises a hand. The Apiarist steps away from the hive and removes his hat to reveal a long thin face, keen eyes - INSPECTOR MENDEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mendel, now in an overcoat and carrying a battered briefcase, climbs into the back of the car with a nod to Smiley and Guillam in the front. He begins to roll a cigarette as Guillam drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stow-away BEE appears from somewhere and begins to buzz around the car. Guillam and Mendel swat at it clumsily. Smiley stares ahead in silence. He winds down the window and the bee flies to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shabby rooming house, near Paddington station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, faded floral monstrosity of a room. TWO single beds, a large leather CHAIR, a WIRELESS. Smiley's new landlady MRS POPE GRAHAM is supervising a gormless teenager - NORMAN - who is struggling into the room with a rickety card table. Mendel and Guillam take i from him and set it into the room. From the next room com the unmistakable sounds of someone having sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re the table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Georgian, I shouldn't lend it to you but since Mister Mendel recommends you... She gives the table a sentimental tap, raising her voice little to drown out the excesses from the room next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will love it for me won't you? It belonged to Mister Pope- Graham. She glances at Smiley who has his back to her looking out into the London street. SMILEY'S P.O.V. ... looking out at rooftops opposite and a travel agents sign which reads THE WIDE WORLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend just wants peace and quiet in order to work, Mrs Pope- Graham, no disturbances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's what he shall have. You want anything you can ask Norman, can't he, Norman? And they leave. A small silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MENDEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her real name is plain Graham. Added the Pope for a touch of class. Guillam gives a grunt of amusement. MENDEL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best informant I ever had.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Smiley has turned his attention to the bed. He examines t stained sheets with distaste. As he speaks he strips off the soiled sheet and replaces it with a clean one from hi bag. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control lived with his sister didn't he? He straightens up from the bed, smooths the pristine shee Mendel flips his notebook back. He's already there. MENDEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basingstoke. Not much of a paper- trail as you can imagine. His pension and she owns a block of bedsits in her own name in West London. GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should... Mendel flicks another page. MENDEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Webb and Bryson are the letting agents. Properties in half of the west end judging by this list...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Guillam is lying on the bed. Smiley stands at the window, Mendel slumped in an armchair. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're only looking for short term rentals. Within the last year. MENDEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reading from the list) A Miss Hilliard. L. Cavaleri? D Weaver, M Crowley, M Cushing. F. Farling. G. Hiaasen. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Mrs Hawcombe. R. Kee. M. Kass. H Staunton... CLOSE on Smiley as his eyes flickers at the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K. Menzies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long was H. Staunton a tenant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Consulting the list)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still is. Been renting for a few years now. Something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Musing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard Staunton. Control used to say he was England's greatest chess master. Died in eighteen seventy- four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam and Smiley approach outside a red-brick mansion block of flats in West London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley and Guillam reach a flat near the shadowy top of t building. Smiley studies the door. He runs his fingers ov the door-frame and there it is - a little WEDGE at the to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam, followed by Smiley, pushes in against a mound of dead mail. They advance cautiously into the dirty flat, the windows fogged out with Windowlene.

dialogues.speaker: TRACKING TOWARDS THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Guillam has reached the DOOR and disappears into the room beyond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A green velvet armchair sits at the centre of a room. Beside it an ashtray over-loaded with stubs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the room is mounded with PILES AND PILES OF PAPERS - files, document boxes, maps and charts, somethin insane in the sprawl of it all. Guillam stands with his back to us staring at a CHESS SET laid out before the chair, as if in mid-game. Four of the chess pieces have had PHOTOGRAPHS of FACES added to them

dialogues.speaker: ROY BLAND. TOBY ESTERHASE. PERCY ALLELINE. BILL HAYDON -
dialogues.text: all wearing paper PARTY HATS. The effect is ridiculous an a little disturbing, like some Surrealist objet d'art. Guillam hears Smiley and turns, almost guiltily, and as h moves we see there is a FIFTH PHOTOGRAPH on a piece - and it is of Smiley himself. Smiley stares at his image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby Esterhase is on the telephone, speaking softly in Hungarian. A look crosses his face. He suddenly notices Haydon in the doorway, cup of tea in hand. Esterhase asks caller to hold and places the handset on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help you with something Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for his Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sullenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's walking the battlements. Toby's eyes flicker toward the handset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Hungarian, subtitled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much obliged. Bill leaves, and Toby resumes the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alleline stands on the rooftop, staring out over the Lond skyline, his expression ambiguous - perhaps obscurely troubled to have found himself at the top. He becomes awa of Roy Bland standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Without turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Yanks. They want to come in and talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alleline continues to stare out over the world, but allow himself a small smile of triumph - and relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course they do. We have Witchcraft. And they don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mendel and Guillam carry in boxes, each overflowing with files and bundles of yellowing papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Anywhere will do. They dump the files and Smiley turns to survey his room. his hand he is toying with a black chess piece labelled "KARLA". The far wall is now stacked to the ceiling with the contents of Control's room - thousands of files and documents, piled in no logical order. The three survey th mountain of information in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Wryly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That enough for you to be getting on with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Peter, I need you to do something for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Scalphunters" floor. Guillam is in his office, paint out panels below the waist, glass above. He sits, hands o the desk, steeling himself for what he has to do. Abruptly he stands and walks out. We TRACK with him as he walks through the Scalphunters "quad" area - a worn out sofa, the old pool table. One of the Scalphunters - KASPAR - stands flirting with a pretty SECRETARY - BELINDA - the "Deb" we saw earlier. Guillam acknowledges them casually as he passes. The girl gives a little wave. She LIKES him. Kaspar stares after Guillam. He doesn't. We continue tracking with Guillam as he leaves the Scalphunters area, walks down the corridor, turns left into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands at the basins, checking the room is clear. Examines his watch, then crosses to the door and opens it crack, peering out. GUILLAM'S P.O.V. We're looking though a glass panelled door at the PERSONN OFFICE. A dapper little man in a club tie - FAWLEY - sits behind his desk, idly tapping a desk toy - a Newton's Cradle. He too checks his watch. Lunch time. Gets up and walks out of his office. Guillam counts to ten under his breath and then abruptly, walks out of the men's room, across the corridor and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cradle is still swinging - steel balls clacking softl Guillam is opening a safe, pulling out documents, photographing them with a SUBMINIATURE CAMERA. Close on the documents as Guillam silently photographs them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the records of staff recently retired. While you're there get the handbook on staff duties... and the diagram of the Circus's reorganization under Alleline... Guillam hears a voice outside. He draws a SMALL KNIFE fro his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaspar opens the door and walks in, finding... the office empty. Then a faint noise. He works his way around the desk, fin Guillam crouched down, his back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Suspicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Peter, didn't know you were doing... whatever you were doing...? Guillam straightens up to reveal his hand oozing blood fr a cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying not to bleed to death. Fawley's got a first aid kit in one of his drawers. Get me a plaster will you? Kaspar busies himself with the first-aid. Eyes hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam has just stepped into the lift. Roy Bland appears suddenly and steps in beside him. Silence for a moment as they descend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard you had an accident. Guillam makes a mental note against Kaspar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it on a drawer handle. (Beat) When are we going to get some new furniture round here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have a word with Esterhase, Peter. We'll make it a priority on the top floor. They arrive on the ground floor. Bland walks out ahead. Guillam exhales with relief. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he walks away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you off to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want some company?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men sit drinking at a table in a nearly deserted local bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you the truth, I'm in no hurry to get back up there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smothered by the Mothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROY BLAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that. Those old birds, all pining for Control. Percy still can't get a decent cup of tea out of them. Still, I imagine it takes time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loyalty. He takes a pull of his pint. ROY BLAND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it was up to me, I'd replace them all with those `naice' girls from registry. Like to hear a few high heels about the place. He reaches suddenly for Guillam's coat, lying on the seat his hand heading for the pocket that holds the SUBMINIATU CAMERA. ROY BLAND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrounge a fag? PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quickly) Here. He pushes his cigarettes into Bland's hand before he can fish in the coat. Bland smokes for a moment. ROY BLAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Suddenly) What do you think of Datsuns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? ROY BLAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Datsuns. Just got one. Wife made me. Hatchback. Caught sight of myself in it, driving past a shop window and I thought to myself "Who's that old fucker?" He stares at Guillam with faint smile, but his eyes are cold and watchful. ROY BLAND (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you driving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Citroen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French? Ooh la la... He continues to stare at Guillam with the faint smile, an Guillam feels a sickening wave of paranoia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink up and I'll drop you back. You've probably got some girl waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam sits alone at the table reading a newspaper. Afte a moment, a man, his lover - RICHARD - a decade or so older - walks behind him, stroking his hair tenderly, and joins him at the table. Guillam automatically checks the window - the flat opposite, a lit window - could someone see them? He gets up and closes the curtains, settles bac at the table, passing Richard a section of the paper. The two sit in domestic contentment, reading.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING DOWN FROM A WINDOW
dialogues.text: A ministerial car pulls up and Lacon climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music - a CHARLIE RICH track - plays on a TRANSISTOR RADIO. Smiley sits at the window listening to the MUSIC. Guillam dictates from a photograph of the documents he to at the circus. Smiley becomes aware that the others are watching him. He turns away, tunes the radio into a DIFFERENT STATION, cutting the Charlie Rich tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry Westerby, dismissed December 4th. And... Connie Sachs, retired November 28th. That's just two weeks after you and Control were forced out. Smiley considers this, turns back to the CHESS SET. He writes Connie's name on a slip of paper, pastes it to a chess piece. There is a knock at the door. Mendel lets LACON into the room excluding a very excited MRS. POPE GRAHAM. Lacon's wearing a tux, looking extremely uncomfortable, almost offended at the role he finds himself playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that car. LACON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On our way to La Bohme. The Minister wondered if there was anything to report? SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much, I'm afraid. We were just discussing the departure of Connie Sachs. I wonder how Research manages without her. PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably relieved. She always struck me as unhinged. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was one of her talents. LACON looks around him, dripping disdain. LACON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Indicating the chess set) Looking a little unhinged yourself, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Distracted) Hmm? He turns to him. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I suppose I am. Perhaps that's what we have to become? A little paranoid? He turns back to the chess board. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Lacon) Your "clean sweep." What if the Mole was actually behind that sweep? What if each of us, whether we knew it or not, represented a threat to the Mole? Lacon looks at a pile of files, distractedly picks one up He starts to leaf through one... LACON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Unconvinced) Control lost his position because of that fiasco in Budapest... that poor chap...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks to Guillam for the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim Prideaux. Smiley nods thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, he did. He writes PRIDEAUX on a slip of paper, pastes it to a che piece. Lacon picks up another file, Something catches his eye: a letter head of FLAMES. He looks up shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get this? This is Witchcraft material. He grabs the piece of paper, stuffing it in his pocket. Smiley looks at him. Lacon reads something implacable in Smiley's gaze... Smiley turns back to the chess set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control was out. And Alleline was in. Thanks to... He writes the name "WITCHCRAFT" and places it on a chess piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacon stalks out of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Alleline's "special source."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no connection. He climbs into the waiting car. We catch a glimpse of the MINISTER in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is connected. The car drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A third-rate English preparatory school. The string orchestra practice - rows of twelve-year old boys sawing away at their instruments. A teacher winces as he hacks a the air above their heads with a ruler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the back of the class we find BILL ROACH. He's plump asthmatic, the last to be chosen for everything. He looks out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roach stares out at us as the rain lashes against the window pane. As we watch an old blue Alvis, towing a battered, second hand CARAVAN, appears - reflected in the window - driving past. Roach watches, thrilled to realise he is the sole witness of this MYSTERIOUS NEW ARRIVAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking down into the dip, at the DRIVER of the blu Alvis, setting up his caravan on bricks, in the gloom and rain. He's wearing a waterproof cape and hood, obscuring his face, giving him something of an air of mystery and menace. There's something odd about the way he moves, something about his back, as if it's been knocked out of true... The Driver rocks the caravan from side to side, loading bricks underneath, trying to get the thing level. He senses something and turns to find Roach behind him. Roach instinctively takes a step back from the hooded figure. Then, gathering his courage, he holds out his han In his palm, a MARBLE.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Roach stands in the caravan, watching the MARBLE as it rolls backwards and forwards on the windowsill - an improvised spirit level. THE MARBLE comes to rest at the centre of the sill, a temporary equilibrium. Roach turns excitedly to the camera, about to call to the Driver, but sees something that stops him in his tracks.. The Driver has stopped, his back to us, breathing hard, perhaps from the exercise or perhaps fighting down some pain. The wind catches at his cape and it flutters to one side, revealing the sweat-soaked shirt beneath. As we wat a DARK STAIN appears at his shoulder blade and begins to spread. It's BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window we see Smiley buying a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley stands at a ticket kiosk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return to Oxford please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large dilapidated Victorian house. We hear the faint sound of voices and pop music coming from the garden. Smiley pushes open the gate, walks down the path, past ov grown shrubbery until he reaches the door with a bell mar

dialogues.speaker: "SACHS."
dialogues.text: Glancing sideways he is caught, entranced, by the sight o young couple kissing in the window. They turn, suddenly a of his presence and Smiley, embarrassed, continues walkin round the house. SMILEY'S P.O.V. A group of students in togas are rehearsing a musical ver of Lysistrata. A young woman, holding her script, is mimi to the song `Don't' by Doris. An older woman wearing rather too much make-up is carryin prop. This is CONNIE SACHS - former Queen of Intelligence the Circus. She examines Smiley for a moment, and then br into a charming smile.

dialogues.speaker: ON SMILEY'S EXPRESSION
dialogues.text: This is not a social call. Connie can't keep the disappointment from her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley sits in the cluttered drawing room, a plate of sco in front of him. Connie appears carrying a tray of tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Of the tea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I brought... He takes the bottle of Scotch from his briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing it hungrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not supposed to. Doctor's orders. Smiley feigns surprise. Connie gives a little girl laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wicked, wicked George. She takes the teacup he pours with crooked arthritic fingers and drinks. They sit, both staring at the student in the garden, caught up in memories of their youth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss it all so much. All my lovely boys. Smiley hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about you, George but I feel seriously under- fucked. They look at each other a moment. Connie's smile fades. She looks at him almost sorrowfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't deserve you, George. Not one hair on your head, never did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley and Connie sit in a dirty, disordered room, Connie on her way to being drunk. As she finishes her glass Smil fills it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left the Circus shortly after I retired...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't leave. I was dismissed. Chucked out on the rubbish heap. (Beat) Like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Ignoring this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? She shrugs, petulant, takes a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Lost my sense of proportion." That's what that personnel cow said. Wouldn't let go of a bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which bone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polyakov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley nods, a look of boredom settling on his face - A SURE SIGN OF INTEREST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polyakov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cultural Attach Polyakov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stationed where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. London. Turned up in sixty five. And I had a feeling, as soon as I laid eyes on him. But that little swine Toby Esterhase told me I was seeing Spies under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esterhase said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had him graded Persil. Whiter than white. And that was that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you disagreed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty Polly? Very military bearing for someone who's never supposed to have been in the army. But, he was good. Went to Embassy functions, lectures. I love a man who lives his cover. Never put a foot wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never? She can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (As if summoning him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty Polly. Pretty Polly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie is working late. She sits in front of a Steenbeck flatbed editing table, she's chain-smoking, unkempt, but completely focused on the moving images on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONNIE SACHS (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the busiest culture vulture that Embassy ever had. On the walls around her are framed STILLS from the footag she is watching: Russian Officials at ceremonies - each picture gridded, each official labelled as Connie manages identify them. CONNIE SACHS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For years we'd been hearing rumours that Karla was building a private army of his own, outside Moscow Centre. We knew he had agents scattered round the globe. I started spending time with the Moscow gazers combing Soviet bulletins and any material I could get. ON SCREEN - Ancient SOVIET VETERANS stand in rows display the medals on their chests. CONNIE SACHS (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late one night in Research, I was trawling through some footage of May Day in Berlin, 1969. I saw something, George. Connie slows the images down, concentrating... OFFICIALS suits are walking into their designated places. We see POLYAKOV amongst them. One of the old SOVIET VETERANS, in dress uniform, a chest full of medals, possibly a touch senile, LOOKS at him. Ju before he is obscured by another official we see what the veteran does. He salutes Polyakov. Connie's smile of triumph is reflected on the screen. She lights a cigarette. CONNIE SACHS (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it, George. Connie rewinds the tape and we see the salute - backwards And again - forwards. CONNIE SACHS (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would a distinguished soldier, four medals for gallantry, salute our cultural attache Polly? Unless Polly was a war veteran himself? And if he was, why hide the fact? FROM DOORWAY - Connie sits smoking her celebratory cigare at the centre of her obsession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie is showing the footage to Alleline and Esterhase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went straight to Esterhase and Alleline. I said - "Polyakov is a Karla-trained Hood if ever I saw one. And if he's here it's because he's running a mole."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did they say? Alleline switches off the image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Hard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're to leave Polyakov alone. You're becoming obsessed with him. He glances at Esterhase and then back to Connie, eyes col

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're losing your sense of proportion, Connie. Perhaps it's time you went out into the real world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connie sits on her bed, with Smiley, drunk now, eyes wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate the real world. (Beat) What does it matter? Old Circus is gone anyway, apart from Bill Haydon. Better off out of it. (Beat)I know you never liked him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What nonsense. What on earth makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to the shoe box beside her, takes out a PHOTOGRAPH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are. The Nursery in our day. She shows him the photograph - a young Connie in Wren uniform, young men in cricket whites on a mown lawn. More senior figures stand behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Control himself, you behind him, as usual... A younger bespectacled Smiley, lost amongst his more glamorous colleagues. She traces other faces with a crook finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Fondly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim Prideaux... and Bill Haydon. Together of course. The Inseparables. All my boys. That was a good time, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Chiding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the war, Connie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real war. Englishmen could be proud then. She stares at the photograph with a sad smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was right, then? About Polyakov. There's a mole? Smiley doesn't answer, stands up to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's bad, don't come back. I want to remember you all as you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house we saw in the title sequence. The air duct open on the front of the house, spilling out its star-shape of light. After a moment Polyakov walks up to the door and knocks. hear the dog barking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs McCraig opens the door for him and he passes her with smile, heading upstairs. We TRACK with Mrs McCraig as she walks back to her pantry opens a cupboard to reveal a huge reel to reel TAPE RECORDER. With ancient fingers she presses down the clunk record button and the spools begin to revolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... The Priest is surprised to see General Secretary Krushchev...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we saw it in the titles. The Mystery Man sits at the table holding up pages of a document for Polyakov who is photographing them as he talks, the camera giving a satisfying CLICK and WHIR with each shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He says "Father, father, I've just had sex with two 17 year old girls." The Priest says "That's quite a sin, but you're an Atheist, General Secretary..." HIGH ANGLE - the dusty candelabra above their heads, and the tint MICROPHONE, nestled beside one of the bulbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... why are you telling me?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... spools churning silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Krushchev says "I'm seventy- seven, I'm telling everyone." We hear his chuckle and the continued CLICK WHIR of the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley sits at his desk staring at the CHESS SET laid out before him. One of the pieces has had the photograph of POLYAKOV added to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins to register the faint noises around him... Pigeons on the ledge outside the window, the television mast creaking on the roof above him... He hears footsteps approaching down the corridor and stop outside his room. He crosses to the door and opens it and finds CONTROL waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step into my lair. And in an instant we are in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control is at the HEAD OF THE TABLE. Ranged against him a PERCY ALLELINE, ROY BLAND and TOBY ESTERHASE- all a littl nervous. BILL HAYDON sits to the side, feet up. Smiley joins them without his spectacles. Control throws him a FILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Smiley)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down and take a look at this nonsense. Smiley sits down and begins to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report by Soviet High Command on their recent naval exercises in the Black Sea. Just what the Admiralty have been begging us for some information on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Engrossed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. Percy and his little cabal walked in with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Protesting "cabal")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Esterhase. Control waves him down. Smiley considers the report dispassionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's genuine it's gold-dust. (Beat) But its topicality makes it suspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control turns to Alleline, with a mocking smile. CONTROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley is suspicious, Percy. Smells a fake. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does it come from? What's the access? CONTROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy doesn't feel like telling. Percy packs his pipe, enjoys the moment - the young lion challenging the old. PERCY ALLELINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new secret source of mine. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how could he possibly have access to...? PERCY ALLELINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has access to the most sensitive levels of policy making. Smiley stares at him, staggered. If it's true, this is th jackpot. Alleline enjoys his amazement, he leans over - points with bureaucratic pride to the FLAMES on the LETTE HEAD. PERCY ALLELINE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have named the operation "Witchcraft." SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Faintly) We? CONTROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy and his pals have bypassed us, Smiley. Gone straight to the Minister. Everyone's very excited. Percy's to be allowed to keep the identity of his new friend top secret. PERCY ALLELINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Minister agrees with me that too many secrets are blown around here. Too much failure, too many scandals, too little solid intelligence! Control is still smiling but only now do we realise he is almost shaking with fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luckily Percy's cabal has come to save us. PERCY ALLELINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Bulldozing on) It's all office politics here. ROY BLAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy does have a point, Control. We should be fighting communism, not each other. PERCY ALLELINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile we're losing our reputation, our partners... CONTROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your bloody Yanks! PERCY ALLELINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shouting) And we've had enough! There's going to be changes, Smiley! Changes. Toby Esterhase finds his moment. TOBY ESTERHASE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to decide if we're part of the past, or part of the future. CONTROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Contemptuous) I should have left you where I found you. ROY BLAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control, if we could all just... CONTROL

dialogues.speaker: OUT
dialogues.text: Alleline, Bland and Esterhase leave. For a moment it look as if Haydon will stay, but then he stands up, shaking hi head and saunters out. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cautiously) If Witchcraft is genuine... Now the others have left, Control seems to sag under the weight of some unnamed fear. He turns a haggard face to Smiley. CONTROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust miracles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a KNOCKING and find ourselves back in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mendel holds two mugs of tea in one hand, gives the agree knock at Smiley's door again. After a moment a bleary Smiley opens the door and lets him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mendel passes him the tea, takes in the desk piled high with papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Of the tea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Courtesy of Mrs P. You been up all night? Smiley sits down wearily, sips his tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Mendel notices one SLIP OF PAPER, sitting alone on the opposite side of the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Request for a thousand pound's in cash from the reptile fund.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a Mister Ellis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Ellis? Smiley leans back, rubs his tired eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was one of Jim Prideaux's work names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so strange about that then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The date. Prideaux was killed in Hungary a year ago. October twenty first. So why was

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: someone giving him a thousand pounds two months later? He takes another sip of tea, gazes at Mendel thoughtfully

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prideaux is running around the track, pounding along with odd, loping stride. A group of BOYS watch him pass. One - SPIKELEY - mimics the run to the amusement of the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire burns in the little grate. ROACH sits near the back of the class. The BOY behind sla the back of his neck with a ruler. Roach flinches but doesn't say anything. The Boy does it again. Prideaux drops a pile of books onto the desk of a boy - SPIKELY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand those out. He crosses to the board begins to write on it - JE M'APPELLE MONSIEUR ELL... Behind him Spikely hands out the books, continuing to wal like a HUNCHBACK. The class snigger. Prideaux hears but doesn't turn, continues writing. Then from the CHIMNEY comes an unnerving SCRABBLING sound A little soot falls... The sniggering fades out as all eyes turn nervously to th fire... what is that noise? Then, with a terrifying SCREECH, an OWL drops down into t grate, thrashes in the flames before flapping out into th class, its wings now ON FIRE, shrieking hideously, headed straight for Spikely who stands frozen in shock as the bi swoops towards his face. Then... ... somehow, Prideaux is THERE and grabs the burning bird from the air and in a second has it folded in on itself, NECK SNAPPED, and strides out of the room with it. The boys stare after their new teacher in SHOCKED SILENCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roach is hiding, spying down on the caravan below, where Prideaux sits in the doorway, massaging his raised shoulder, and drinking something from a green beaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (After a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come down here. Frightened, Roach obeys, sliding down the dip to him. Prideaux examines him fiercely. Finally his face relaxes little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Identifying him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy with the marble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gave me a turn up there, parked on the horizon. Thought you were a Juju man. What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, Roach, sir. Bill. I'm a new boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New arrival, eh? Middle of year? What's the story? Roach hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Blushing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother and father... my father's left, so... He doesn't know how to explain his misery any further. Prideaux pretends not to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill? The unpaid Bill. Anyone ever call you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Known a lot of Bills. They've all been good `uns. What you good at? Roach tries desperately to think of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing sir. The boy's eyes start to MIST UP. Prideaux looks down, busies himself with brushing at something on his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good watcher though eh? Us loners always are. No one else spotted me when I turned up here. Best watcher in the unit, Bill Roach is, I'll bet. Long as he's got his specs on. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gratefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Prideaux finishes his drink, nods to Roach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free period, isn't it? Don't waste it down here. Roach sets off up the dip. He looks back and sees Prideau has walked into the caravan and stands with his back to him, rubbing his aching shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley walks up to the steps of his home, stops, examinin the door, his absent-minded air hardening into something more ALERT. He scans the step and stoops to pick somethin up. A WEDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley walks into the hallway senses alert. He pads towar the drawing room, wipes sweat from his hands on his trousers, steels himself. Is it finally Them, come for hi He walks in and finds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICKI TARR sits smoking in the darkness, the knife on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Mister Smiley. You remember me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Ricki. He tosses the wedge onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You missed a wedge. RICKI TARR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Losing my touch. Smiley watches him closely, very aware of the knife. Tarr rubs his beard. RICKI TARR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I must look like. Rip Van Winkle. Feel like him. I could sleep for a year. Two years. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where've you been, Ricki? RICKI TARR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, there. Run out of places now. They're gonna kill me. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is? RICKI TARR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your lot. Or their lot. Whoever gets me first. I'm innocent, by the way. Within reason. (Beat) You going to find him then? The Mole? Smiley crosses to another chair. As he does so he's scanning the room - automatically noting the changes - th remains of a meal on a table... SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to try. How long have you been here? RICKI TARR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Few days. Needed somewhere to hide. Smiley notices the pile of letters for his wife Ann - they've been disturbed. RICKI TARR (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Following his gaze) Old habits. Smiley fights down his anger. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't use my home as a safe house. There's every chance they're watching it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calculated risk Mister Smiley. I wanted to see you, figured you'd turn up here sooner or later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want Ricki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a woman. I want you to trade for her. Get her back from Karla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What woman? Tarr finishes his cigarette, lights another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name's Irina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricki Tarr emerges blinking into the white sunshine. Groomed, smart, that same restless energy. A car pulls up across the road TUFTY THESINGER - a boiled-looking Britis spy, not over-bright, signals to him. Tarr pulls his shad down and saunters over to his ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met her in Istanbul. They'd found some Russian trade delegate, name of Boris. He was spending high and wide in the nightclubs and some idiot thought we could turn him. Tarr opens the back seat and gets in. Tufty's slightly foolish smile slips a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarr enters, followed by Tufty carrying one of his bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nineteenth century European grandeur. But the apartment we're in is deserted and in a state of disrepair. Tarr stands at tripod mounted BINOCULARS set back from the window, idly playing with a knife with a distinctive whit BONE handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TARR'S P.O.V. - the HOTEL opposite - a Brutalist concrete slab, the rooms have floor to ceiling windows. In the bedroom a heavy set man - BORIS - is having sex with a MAID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took one look and saw that he was a hood, Moscow trained. We TRACK to one side, and see the "drawing room" of the hotel suite, where Boris' two MINDERS, SERGEI and IVAN, wait, smirking at the sounds coming from the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably coat trailing, trying to draw one of our men out into the open. We TRACK further along again and see the CORRIDOR outside the hotel room, where a YOUNG WOMAN has just arrived. Thi is IRINA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a wife with him. Common- law. Irina opens the door and walks into the drawing room, whe the Minders stare fixedly at the floor, trying not to laugh. She walks on past and into the bedroom. The Maid jumps out of the bed, grabs her clothes and flees. Boris lies, unconcerned, reaches for his cigarettes. Irina walks past him and we track with her as she enters BATHROOM. The glass window here is two-thirds frosted and we lose her as she bends over a basin. Something about her has caught Tarr's attention and he leaves the binoculars, walking closer to the window. Suddenly IRINA straightens up, her head above the frosted glass and stares straight at us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICKI TARR standing at the window opposite, knowing he should turn away, but somehow snagged by that look. A moment between the two. Then a car sweeps past on the road below and there's a flash of light behind Ricki's he - the headlights reflected in the lenses of the now visib BINOCULARS. Irina absorbs this. Above everything else, anger at her humiliation being observed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Irina walks back out of the bathroom, picks up a vase and hurls it at Boris, just missing him. He stubs out his cigarette and calmly climbs out of the bed. As we watch h draws the curtains along the length of the room, obscurin our view. Seconds later the curtains billow as Irina is thrown against them. We watch as her shape is rolled alon the window by the force of Boris' blows. Finally the billowing fabric settles. Moments later Boris opens the curtains again and starts to dress. Irina lies on the bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricki watches the street below as Boris, Sergei and Ivan exit the hotel, head for a night out. Tarr pulls on his own jacket, grabs his knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRINA'S P.O.V. - Her husband and the Minders are heading for a row of gaudy nightclubs. And someway behind him, Ricki Tarr, trailing. She exhales a breath on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarr approaches the night club, glancing around quickly before slipping inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricki Tarr enters. He scans the room for Boris, spotting Tufty Thesinger at a table. He crosses towards him, watching as Boris and the two minders are entertained by the clubs hostesses. Boris calls for more drinks, clutching a bundle of currency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to be a long night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You baby-sit this one. Ricki walks towards us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irina answers the door and finds Ricki Tarr outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your bloke's a bit of a bastard. (Beat) Just wanted to check you were alright. She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was something about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarr exhales smoke. Smiley studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were due to fly home the next day. What did you tell London?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Didn't have anything to tell yet. But... I could sense it in her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sense what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricki Tarr is talking to a man. A sports car lies under a sheet. The deal concluded, the man pulls back the sheet t reveal the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irina is driving, exhilarated, free. Ricki Tarr is on the back seat, sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A workers canteen on the Bosphorus. Tarr and Irina sit drinking wine, talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I played the businessman, Michael Trench. A Holiday Romance. Thought I'd take my time with it... Tarr gently traces a bruise on Irina's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But second date she made this open play... We see a growing attraction between them. Irina and Tarr laughing, flirting. They move closer to on another. Tarr feels he is the master of this situation. Suddenly Irina withdraws. She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you are. A long beat. Tarr waits her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like to talk to your boss Control. I have something to trade. Something big. I want a new life in the West. Tarr desperately tries to stay looking calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is the deal. You tell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley sits with his hooded, bored look, examining everyt carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What made you so sure she wasn't coat-trailing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've all got our strengths. And weaknesses. He flicks a look at the pile of Ann's letter, an insolent smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, I know women. She said she had a secret. The mother of all secrets. Said she'd only tell Control. She wanted to trade. New life for her and her kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had children in Russia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why they let her and Boris out. So, I said I'd tell the Circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you didn't? Tarr's smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irina prowls the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanted to find out more first. So, I waited her out. Tarr lounges by a window, smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Shrugging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't expect them to jump at every offer of service.(Beat. Carefully) If they had more information... Irina doesn't answer, paces. Tarr lets his face harden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you won't tell me more, there's nothing I can do. She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I tell you, I'm putting my life in your hands. The lives of my children? Do you understand? She walks slowly towards him, bends over, begins to whisp in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two make love, passionate, Irina trying to bind him t her. Tarr responds, excited by her, now that she needs hi We intercut their intense love-making with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drunk Boris groping a very young hostess on a dance floor, his shirt undone. He starts to strip the girl of h uniform, amused by her efforts to keep her clothes on.
