Th two minders clap in time to the music, encouraging him. Boris grabs the girl by the hair, biting her neck, laughing, eyes glazed with drink, barely able to stand... The inane music blares on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Tarr and Irina stare at each other. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tenderly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me you'll be careful. No details to the Circus. Not until we're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarr threads his way through the crowds of evening shoppe and tourists, holding in his head the BIGGEST SECRET of h career. There's something new on his face - AMBITION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gliding above the respectable front of a Business OFFICE, through the RECEPTION - which maintains the cover story of an Import/Export outfit... ...over a back-room and through a STEEL DOOR to the CYPHE ROOM beyond where we find a drunk TUFTY THESINGER watchin Tarr send a CODED MESSAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were supposed to have gone. London stations's been on to me. They want to know what the hell you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley takes off his glasses and wipes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did your message say, Ricki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just that I had a Moscow Centre trained hood wanting to defect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else? Tarr looks at him. For the first time there's something else behind his smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand how you felt. You wanted to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I am to the Circus. One of the scalp-hunters. Someone to give the dirty jobs to. I wanted to bring this one in myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I quite see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said that she claimed to have information crucial to the well- being of the Circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That she had information concerning a Double Agent. He colours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just trying to... to get the proper attention. (Beat) And I told them to tell Mister Guillam that this was the reason I hadn't come home, not because I'd defected or anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened next Ricki?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I waited for a reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense Tarr sits waiting for a reply. It's dark outside. Thesinger is asleep at his desk. The TICKER MACHINE begin to rattle into life. Tarr jumps to it. Tarr begins to decode the in-coming message on a one-time pad. INSERT - "We read you"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I waited hours but that was all they sent. It didn't make sense. Like they were stalling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarr stands staring across at Irina's hotel balcony with binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BORIS stands looking straight at him. The hint of a mocki smile. Behind him we can just see SERGEI and IVAN sitting in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boris turns from the balcony, exhaling smoke from a cigarette, the faint smile still on his lips. He looks up his expression CHANGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarr bolts down an alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is ajar... a radio is playing LOUD POP MUSIC. Ta pauses on the threshold, senses alert. He takes out his KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fan stirs the dusty air. Tarr walks in and stops. Tufty lies on the floor, in a pool of blood. He's been tortured one eye gouged out. The other manages to convey a rather touching amazement at the violence worked on him. His thr has been slit wide open. Tarr absorbs this, looks at the knife in his own hand, turns and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A desperate Tarr hurries towards a phone.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM THROUGH THE HALF-OPEN DOOR -
dialogues.text: Irina enters the hotel room. She stops a moment, afraid. Then she looks towards us.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: Irina is backing out of the room. We catch a glimpse of t BUTCHERED REMAINS of BORIS hanging from the shower rail, garroting wire around his neck. He's been tortured, the shower curtain used to catch the pooling blood. She BACKS AWAY across the room to the door, leaving a tra of bloody footprints on the pale carpet. She turns to the door, looks out of the SPY HOLE. Her P.O.V. - two men, TINY DISTORTED FIGURES walking down the corridor towards her. The phone starts to RING. Irina glances at it, knowing it too late for her. SPY-HOLE - The TWO FIGURES loom closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - Crowds of people throng the busy port. A paranoid Ricki watches from the back of the hall. He notices a child react to something - follows his gaze... TARR'S P.O.V. - behind glass panels - a glimpse of three wheeling a gurney - a bandaged figure upon it. Just befor the figure disappears, a hand moves a little... Tarr watches Irina's departure, sick with guilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarr picks at a loose thread on his cuff, mind still back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They put her on a ship. That's all I know. I've done a lot of things Mister Smiley, but... I don't know why... I keep thinking about her. (Beat) He smiles, almost bewildered by his own feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wasn't even my type. (Beat) I want to get her out. I owe her that. He stands up abruptly, heading for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going Ricki? You said yourself, Karla will be looking for you. I can take you somewhere. Keep you safe. Tarr's face twists with mirth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's going to keep you safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are peering down the lift shaft as new secrets are winched towards us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alleline sits in his baronial chair, alone in the room. H looks what he is. A man who knows he's OUT OF HIS DEPTH. Across from him the SAFE stands, an almost malignant presence. Alleline stares at it, a light film of sweat on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark warren of corridors and glassed SQUASH COURTS somewhere under-ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alleline walks along the courts, new racquet in hand, uncomfortable in his too- tight white shorts. He reaches court. Inside LACON and the MINISTER are playing a furiou game of squash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men stand talking within the transparent cube o the court. Lacon and the Minister are still sweating from their game. The Minister is smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy has always resisted suggestions of wider exploitation of Witchcraft's intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the bloody jargon, Lacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've refused to share Witchcraft with our allies, so far, Minister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greedy boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goal has been to establish his track record beyond all doubt. I think the time has come to approach our American brothers-in- arms. The Minister considers this with some excitement, takes a drag on his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they'll take us back into bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in a one-off trade. I want on-going access to American intelligence. This stops the Minister. He turns to face Alleline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think we can get it? Alleline senses he has just risen several rungs. He slash inexpertly with his racquet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Witchcraft on our side, I think we can get anything we bloody-well want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley swims in the placid water. We hear music. The tink of glasses from a happy Christmas party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock out-rage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - And we are back in the Circus. We find Control - arm outstretched, finger pointing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy. Did you do this? A Christmas Party of the past. Control, at the height of his powers, a punch glass in hand. Noise and music: the normally earnest atmosphere of the Circus released in an unexpectedly boisterous gathering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You penny pinching Scot. Can you not take a bloody order. No one is to tamper with the recipe. It's going to take us five hours to get drunk on this piss water. Alleline tries to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I followed the recipe. He glances nervously at his wife, a vivacious alcoholic, just beginning to make a show of herself. She puts a CROW SHAPED party hat from the cracker onto Alleline's head. H brushes it off, anxious not to appear the fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Muttering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake Mary... BILL HAYDON, wearing a crown from the cracker at a rakish angle, appears in the nick of time, leads Alleline's wife for a dance, teasing the sullenness from her. They're goo dancers. Alleline relieved, crisis averted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find Smiley trapped in a conversation with an earnestl drunk deb. Control raises his arm above the melee. He's still at the punch bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley? Where's Ann? Get me a lady of taste? Ann will sort it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grateful to get away from the deb)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go find her. Smiley threads his way through the party, walking amongst his colleagues, enjoying himself... Jerry Westerby and Connie Sachs are arm in arm, singing along to a song - "T Second Worst Spy in the World." They link Smiley to them for a verse, others joining in around them. The song segu into the Russian National Anthem. The crowd sing lustily, many of them Russian-speaking, enjoying the chance to sin with vigour. Smiley walks on. Behind him the song ends to be replaced the CHARLIE RICH song we heard earlier. His P.O.V. - - One of the larger Mothers doubled up with laughter, pulling a cracker with a flushed TOBY ESTERHASE, hopeless outweighed, but competitive to the finish. - ROY BLAND with his plain wife, eyeing one of the pretty debs as she dances by. A mother takes Smiley by the hand and leads him briefly into the dance. Smiley takes a turn with her, and extricates himself. Still smiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he walks down a dark corridor, the noise of the party fading away behind him. He stops seeing something in the shadows of an office. Fo a moment he doesn't understand what he's seen.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Two shapes locked in an embrace. Smiley stands, nakedly absorbing the body blow. Then he turns and walks back to the heat and noise of the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley and Guillam sit on a bench. Smiley has his towel, hair wet from his swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look tired. Smiley considers telling Guillam about Tarr's visit, but instinct for secrecy wins out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I didn't sleep well. (Beat) I want you to get something for me, Peter. I need the duty officer's log book for last November. I'm sorry, but I'm going to have to send you up a floor, into the Lion's den. (Beat) If you have the slightest reservation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is feeling sick to your stomach a slight reservation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're caught, Peter, you can't mention me. I'm sorry, but you're alone. Guillam nods. He gets up and walks quickly away. After a moment a MAN rises from a nearby bench and saunters over. It's Mendel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're clean. Nothing on your back. Nothing on your conscience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LORRY roars past, wiping frame and revealing Guillam arriving at the circus, carrying his briefcase. He spring up the four steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam is at the security gate at the dingy lobby. The security guard, Bryant, steps from his box. Beyond him is the row of lifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Guillam? How's the family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, Bryant. Up to Registry today. BRYANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay sir. Yellow one for the bag sir. Bryant stamps a PINK chit and hands it to Guillam, pullin open the lift cage. He gives him a yellow slip for the ba Guillam climbs inside and begins to ascend, rattlingly slowly. As Bryant's head disappears... PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time you oiled this thing, isn't it? BRYANT (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We keep asking... Guillam examines the chit. He wipes his hands. For the first time we realize how NERVOUS he is. Polished shoes appear as they reach the floor, then the uniform trousers of a short man. A self-important JANITOR Guillam steps out and the Janitor checks Guillam's pink a yellow chit and motions him through a turnstile. Then he stops him short. He gestures for Guillam to raise his arm PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New rules. Guillam is briskly frisked. PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind the jewels. JANITOR PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pen and watch sir. He holds up a box and Guillam hands him his fountain pen and watch. The search over Guillam sets off down the corridor, unnerved by the task ahead - betraying his own kind. BILL HAYDON (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing up here? Guillam freezes. Then he turns. It's Bill Haydon standing in a doorway, frowning at him over his spectacles. A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look pleased to see me, Bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I be? You bloody pariah. Then Bill grins, the grin transforming his face. Guillam smiles back, relief mixing with real warmth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We like the Scalp-hunters to know their place. On the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing some research. Makes a change from sitting on my arse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard it was quiet down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the grave. When're you going to give us something to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you heard? Technology's the future. No need for you apes anymore. I can get you a posting to Northern Ireland if that helps get the blood racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks anyway. Stick to sitting on my arse. They've reached the end of the corridor. Haydon peels awa a hand raised in farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam arrives at a counter which serves to block entry the vast archive of files beyond. A Janitor appears in th entrance. He pushes a book towards Guillam to sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Guillam's bag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to look after that for you, Mister Guillam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta give you a chit. The Dolphin'll kill me if I don't. New Rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, chit me. The Janitor grins, slaps a chit on the bag, raises the counter and Guillam enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few researchers sit amongst stacks of files. Guillam is filling out requisition slips. Behind the desk, a woman - SAL - watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you up to this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rakish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visiting aunts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet. She takes the flimsy's from the back of the slips and pos them into her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corridor D. She hands him back the top copies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two-eights are halfway on your right, the three-ones are next alcove down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mendel sits in his car, watching the garage fore-court. H looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIFT CAGE we saw earlier is being raised from the flo by a Janitor at the winch. Another janitor is removing files from it. Radiating out from the lift cage are the shelves of files that make up the reading room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find Guillam moving along the shelves reading the fluorescent number cards. He takes a file out, leaving hi green slip in the brackets provided by each file. Guillam looks across at his real objective... A row of anonymous looking files on the next aisle - the archived DUTY OFFICER'S LOG-BOOKS, spines bearing the yea and month they cover. And in his way - a GIRL perched on a ladder, a MAN mendin a radiator. The Man turns round and stares straight at Guillam. Suddenly he POINTS STRAIGHT AT HIM. For a moment Guillam freezes, unnerved. Then he glances over his shoulder and realises the Man is communicating with anoth WORKMAN behind him. Abruptly, Guillam walks over to the file and swaps it, keeping the title close to his chest. He goes back to his desk, a light film of sweat on his forehead. He sits, a pencil clamped between his teeth, waiting... From somewhere nearby comes the sound of a PHONE RINGING, then being answered. Moments later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Guillam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telephone sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as though distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh to hell, who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside line, sir. Someone rough. The garage, I think, regarding your car. Guillam walks over to the counter, the stolen file hugged to his chest. A LOCKED BOX on a trolley is wheeled towards him and is opened to reveal the OUTSIDE LINE TELEPHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (Beat) Well, damn. Can't you do the bloody repair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mendel is using the office phone, an ELDERLY GERMAN MECHANIC, stands outside guarding the office door. In the background a POP TUNE is playing on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't be done sir, you're going to need a new gear box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Guillam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least get on to the main dealers first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Mothers is listening routinely in on the call, TAPE SPOOLS revolving, recording the conversation. The PO TUNE plays, insidiously working its way into her head. Sh idly taps her pen along to the tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got the number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hold on... He cups his hand over the mouthpiece...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Alwyn? Chuck me the bag a minute, will you? Alwyn gets Guillam's bag and brings it over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Alwyn goes back to his post. Guillam, still hugging the phone, takes out a BEIGE file from his bag and switches i with the one against his chest. He takes an address book from the bag and finds a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 946-0335. OK? Thanks. He hangs up, hands the bag back to Alwyn and steps back into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam retraces his steps, placing his dummy file in the pink stack, replacing the one he placed there in its original shelf, remembering to take the green slip from t bracket. It's done. Guillam takes the green slip and hands it to Sal, who sig it and puts it on its spike. Guillam turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOBY ESTERHASE is standing in front of him. Unfriendly eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we see you Peter? For a second Guillam can't speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Percy would like quite an urgent word with you. Can you come now to the fifth floor? That would be so kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Esterhase turns and Guillam, mind whirring, follows him back out through the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alwyn, inspired)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might just throw that into the lift for me, mark it for the second floor, save me filling out more bloody chits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will do sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mothers sit over their typewriters as Guillam and Esterhase walk through into the anteroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting from the other room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esterhase, I'll have no phone calls, tell them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief will take no calls, please, ladies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Muttering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can hear. Toby holds the door open for Guillam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are having a conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alleline sits in the baronial chair, Bland at his left. Haydon on his right. Esterhase trots over to his seat. Guillam takes in the REPORT they all seem to have spread out in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now young Peter Guillam, are you ready for me finally? Guillam, affecting ease, leans against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you getting up to down there these days, apart from chasing our virgins... Guillam catches a smirk from Esterhase - mocking him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple of Arab ploys look quite promising. Other than that, getting quite good at ping-pong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arabs... You can rent one but you can't buy one. Right Bill? He looks up from the report. Here it comes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Ricki Tarr these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Not missing a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. We have tea at Fortnum's every afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I require the matter of your discussion with Tarr. Guillam shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell him. He'll be thrilled. Alleline lets the silence build, rather like a bad actor. Everyone is staring at Guillam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that shrug for? He SLAMS a hand on the desk, tea-cups rattling, a sudden roar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PERCY ALLELINE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking to you about a murderer. I'm talking to you about a defector from your own damn section! I'm accusing you of consorting with an enemy agent behind my back! Don't damn well shrug at me! How'd you like a term in prison? Guillam's own temper comes to his rescue. PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I haven't been seeing him! So get your facts straight and get

dialogues.speaker: OFF MY BACK
dialogues.text: A moment, while the room digests this. A relaxation of th tension, as if he's passed some kind of test. PERCY ALLELINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if I told you that Tarr had recently arrived in Paris would you be surprised? PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing would surprise me about Tarr. PERCY ALLELINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I told you we happen to know that thirty thousand pounds mysteriously appeared in his bank account last month, would that surprise you? This DOES shock Guillam, but he manages to hold on to his sullen expression. PERCY ALLELINE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your man's a defector, Guillam. Got turned by the opposition months ago and now they've sent him back to us! PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for? PERCY ALLELINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind what for! To muddy the water, that's what for! Spread a whole lot of damn nonsense to get us chasing our tails! The point is this - he's heading for home. The first peep from him you come to the grown-ups, understood? Anyone you see at this table. But not another damn soul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam is walking to the lifts, we note he is now carryi his BAG. Behind him ROY BLAND is walking down the corrido He peels off, turning left, humming a tune to himself - t same POP SONG that was playing at the garage in the background of Guillam's call. Guillam reacts as he keeps walking, trying to work out if this MEANS SOMETHING. We track with him as his anger and PARANOIA grow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam drives down an alleyway full speed, screeches to halt as he reaches a group of children playing, edges pas them and on into the car body repair shop. He gets and strides past the elderly GERMAN MECHANIC we saw earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (German, subtitled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's waiting for you. Guillam strides on, nerves at snapping point, to the othe end of the workshop where a Vauxhall waits. Behind him the Mechanic and his SON are already beginning to strip the plates off Guillam's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mendel appears by Guillam's side as they walk towards another waiting car, Guillam simmering with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (A faint smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All go smoothly did it? (Beat) Where we off to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel. I have to see George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Smiley isn't at the hotel, sir. Change of venue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarr sits in Control's green velvet armchair watching TV. There's a large tape recorder on the table behind him. We hear the door to the flat opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam hurries into the room, stops, seeing Tarr. Tarr gives his sunny grin but he's sweating, his eyes full of tension. TARR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mister Guillam, sorry I took so long to come back. Guillam punches him in the face, drags him from the chair the two struggling. Behind them Smiley and Fawn appear. Smiley watches coolly for a moment then signals Fawn, who drags Guillam off Tar expertly pinning his arm. FAWN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. Guillam pulls free angrily. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricki's been helping us Peter. (Indicating TAPE DECK) He's been telling us all about his adventures. PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Smiley) He's a double, George! There is no Mole! The whole thing's a pack of lies thought up by Moscow. Karla's bought him for thirty thousand pounds! He pulls the LOG BOOK out of his file. PETER GUILLAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Tarr) I stole that, because of you! I spied on my own. Do you know how that makes me feel? Smiley holds out his hand for the log book. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you did take the trouble to steal it... Guillam hands him the book and Smiley leafs through the pages. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricki, you said you sent the Circus a telegram concerning Irina's information? Tarr sits up, wiping blood from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICKI TARR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sullenly) S'right. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the date? Tarr hesitates, considering. PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know because there was no telegram! The whole thing... RICKI TARR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: November 20th. It would have been November 20th. Evening. Smiley has found the right month. He flicks through the dated pages - 18th November, 19th November... He holds up the book - the next page has been cut out. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: November 20th is missing. (Beat) Someone is covering their tracks Peter. Unless you think that's just a coincidence? Guillam looks thrown. PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the money? SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty thousand isn't so much for Karla to pay if it protects his Mole. I'm afraid someone in the Circus knows all about Mister Tarr and is doing everything they can to discredit him. Guillam takes the log book from Smiley, runs a thumb down the razored edge of the missing page. He notices some writing on the next page. PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reading) "Enquiries to the fifth floor." Smiley takes the book again, examines the note. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You recognize that handwriting? (Beat) That's Toby Esterhase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley and Guillam pull up in front of the hotel. They si in weary silence, staring up at the unprepossessing building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me? That you had Tarr? Smiley looks at him. Guillam reads the look correctly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case I didn't make it out of the Circus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secrecy is a habit. Guillam rubs his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should get some rest. And I suppose you should get your reading done. Smiley nods. Doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men are finishing off a bottle of Scotch. Unusually, Smiley is drunk - a result of the alcohol and the lack of sleep. Guillam lies on one of the single beds, staring at the PHOTOGRAPHS of the four suspects Smiley has pinned on his chessmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to believe Tarr was lying. (Beat) All this time, thinking I'm fighting a war. It's a sham. Karla won years ago and we didn't even know it. Smiley watches Guillam, estimating how badly all of this affecting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met him once. Karla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fifty-five. Moscow Centre was in pieces. Purge after purge. Half their Agents were jumping ship and I travelled around signing them up. Hundreds of them. Guillam raises himself up on an elbow, listening. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them was calling himself Gerstmann. He was on his way back to Russia, and we were pretty sure he was going to be executed. Plane had a twenty-four lay over at Delhi, and that's how long I had to convince him to come over to us instead of going home to die. Smiley stares at the room around, projecting his memory o the Delhi cell onto their present surroundings. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little room...I'm sitting here...he's sitting there... He points to an EMPTY CHAIR in front of him. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans have had him tortured. He holds up his right hand. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fingernails. It's incredibly hot. I'm very tired and all I want to do is get this over with and get back home. Things weren't going well with Ann. Guillam flinches a little, but Smiley doesn't notice, los now in the past. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give him the usual pitch... Come to the West and we can give you a comfortable life. After questioning. Or you can catch your plane and fly home and be shot, like Bykov, Shur, Muranov... He stares at the CHAIR as if expecting an answer, and slightly drunkenly Guillam finds himself turning to the CHAIR for a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER GUILLAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat) What did he say? Smiley doesn't answer - STARES AT THE CHAIR - the silence stretching - it's all becoming a little surreal. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the chair) Think of your wife. You have a wife, don't you? I brought you some cigarettes, by the way. He mimes placing cigarettes on an invisible table, betwee him and the chair. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use my lighter. He mimes placing the lighter beside the cigarettes. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We could arrange for her to join you, we have a lot of stock to trade. If you go back, she'll be ostracised. Think of her. Think about how much she..." He breaks off in sudden impatience with himself. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kept harping on about the damn wife! Telling him more about me, than... Should have walked out, of course, but for some reason... it seemed important to save this one. (Beat) So I go on. "Know you're a chain-smoker, help yourself," "We're not so very different you and I.." He makes a vague "Etcetera" gesture, stares at...

dialogues.speaker: THE EMPTY CHAIR
dialogues.text: ... something unsettling about it, as if somehow it is acquiring the GHOSTLY PRESENCE OF KARLA. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To the chair) Look, we've both spent our lives looking for the weaknesses in one another's systems. Don't you think it's time to recognise there is as little worth on your side as there is on mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Smiley sits back, dropping the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never said a word. Not one word. Next morning he got back on his plane, gave the pack of cigarettes back to me, untouched - this was a chain-smoker, mind - and flew off to what he presumed would be his death. He kept my lighter. It was a gift - "To George, from Ann. All my love." Guillam is still staring at the chair, a little awe-struc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Karla? And he flew back to die rather than give in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (Beat) And that's how I know he can be beaten. Because he's a fanatic. And the fanatic is always concealing a secret doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the thing. (Beat) I can't remember. He stands up, crosses to the window, embarrassed by what has to say next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After today, Peter you have to assume they're watching you. If there's anything you need tidied up... now's the time. Guillam stares at him, realising what he's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam and his boyfriend RICHARD sit at the table, Richa working his way through a stack of essays. Guillam stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearly done. He scores a red line down a piece of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Godsakes... I think they're all sharing the same moronic brain. He notices the way Guillam is staring at him and his smil fades.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: RICHARD, bewildered and upset, is packing his belongings. He walks past Guillam, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With dignity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's someone else, you can tell me. I'm a grown-up. Guillam doesn't say anything. Richard puts the flat keys the side table and leaves. Guillam, stares after his one time lover, heart-broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prideaux's BLUE ALVIS bumps and jolts towards us across t playing fields, an exhilarated ROACH at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Braking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time sir? Prideaux and the rest of the class stand at the "finishin line," but Prideaux is staring down to a line of beech- trees, where a MAN is walking. It's MENDEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got your specs on Jumbo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the fellow down there? Roach stares at the stranger eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he? Beggarman? Thief? Why doesn't he look this way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you look if you saw a bunch of boys flogging a car around a field? Doesn't he like boys? Anyone sees him again, let me know. Don't hold with odd bods hanging about. Might steal the Alvis, which is...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (By rote)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best car in England! They dissolve into laughter, but Roach is still anxiously watching Prideaux, noting how his expression has darkened

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belinda, the deb we met earlier, is doing up her blouse. She's teary and also a little excited that men are fighti over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Stop it! KASPAR has Guillam pinned against the wall and is punchin him. Guillam accepts the blows with a bloody grin. Someth of the school yard fight about it, as the other Scalphunt gather around, ostensibly to break it, up but clearly enjoying the distraction. One of them is trying to pull Kaspar off and, caught by a blow, joins in - the fight escalating as others join in the struggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your bloody hands off her! He kicks at Guillam, who falls. Belinda gives a shriek of alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ's sake, don't fight over a bit of skirt! Guillam lies on the floor taking another kick, but his fa turned to us, registers only relief. Job done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright morning sunshine. Smiley and Guillam walk up concrete steps of a casino building - very modern, imposing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't seen many of the boys and girls for a while, matter of fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley, Guillam and the genial JERRY WESTERBY are sat at blackjack table. The casino is empty, a cleaner vacuums i the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's the way it is, George, isn't it? When you're out, you're out. Too much of this stuff. He points to a drink on the table before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (An old joke between them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much wampum not good for braves. How.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Obliging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How. (Beat) I need to talk to you about the night Jim Prideaux was killed, Jerry. You were duty officer, weren't you? Westerby looks at them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Control asked me to man the phones that night. Said someone was doing a special job for the service. He wanted someone from outside he could trust. If anything came in, I was to tell him and only him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Westerby walks down the corridor. We pass OFFICES - drawe pulled open, waste paper bins standing on desks - the end of day ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Westerby is following a horse race on the radio. A dirty plate in front of him. He drinks from a can of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Westerby is asleep. The Circus is deathly quiet, nothing stirring. Then... A PHONE BEGINS TO RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control sits surrounded by files. A dim green lamp on his desk the only illumination. He looks ill, tense with waiting. Cigarette stubs piled in the ashtray. He listens to the solitary PHONE below him in the buildin Then it is joined by a SECOND. Then a THIRD... Control listens, nerves stretched to their limit. From ju outside - the sound of someone running up the wooden staircase. A knock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Entering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been a bit of a panic, sir. Control raises his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the FO resident clerk... A Hungarian news bulletin, sir. (Reading) British spy, work-name Ellis, travelling with false Hungarian papers, has attempted to kidnap an unnamed Hungarian general in Budapest. He's been shot, other arrests imminent... Control stares at him, stands unsteadily, begins to put o his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have a brief, please? Sir? Do you want me to deny it? Controls stares at him, lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to have a brief sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Westerby is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ann? I'm sorry to bother you. Is George back yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Westerby and Smiley sit opposite each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You rang my house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just on the off chance you were back from Berlin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just that there'd been a bit of a crisis. She said you weren't back yet. That was it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hell broke loose - military yelling about Hungarian tank movements on the border, Lacon and the Minister baying at the door. Thank Christ Bill Haydon turned up when he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSHING BILL HAYDON as he walks up the corridor towards t duty room, cutting a swathe through the people gathered outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. The room clears. Bill sits down. He pulls out all the phone lines, decisiv taking charge. Kicks the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to get hold of you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just picked up half a story on the ticker-tape at my club... Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim Prideaux's been shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haydon goes white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the Hungarian Embassy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With relief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Haydon is on the phones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go and tell your Masters what will happen if one hair on Jim Prideaux's head is damaged... He covers the receiver, turns to Westerby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Esterhase on the phone. Tell him to pull in the Hungarian agents, anyone we're onto. Tell him to get down to the London School of Economics, sandbag some bloody students and put them on ice at Sarratt.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Westerby watches Haydon on the phone from the door. Haydo listens to a voice for a moment, then hangs up. He stands his back to Westerby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any more news on him? Haydon doesn't turn around, head bowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill? (Beat) Oh God, is he...? For a moment it looks like Haydon won't answer but then h seems to master his emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to go to his flat. Clear out anything linked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haydon walks around the neat rooms. A bike up on the wall a pair of muddy climbing boots on a newspaper, waiting to be cleaned. Haydon walks past a shelf - photographs and books. He stops, picks up an unframed black and white sna from the shelf. It's a picture of HIMSELF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haydon stands with his back to us, possibly crying. Weste turns thoughtfully away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley and Guillam sit eating side by side at a bar, Smil examining the hamburger - his first - doubtfully. Guillam is thinking about what he's just been told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haydon heard the news at his club? Smiley is distant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Saville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At one-thirty? The ticker-tape wouldn't be running. Guillam sits, mind racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how did he know? Oh Jesus, George...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. Haydon? How could he have known?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not him, Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how did he know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he was at my house that night. With Ann. Guillam doesn't know what to say. They sit in a hideously awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of the Hamburger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I quite like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone on the nightstand starts to ring. A woman's han reaches into frame and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hello Jerry. No I'm afraid George isn't back yet. In the bed beside her we see Bill Haydon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black Cab pulls up at the lights. Another black cab pul alongside it. The two drivers acknowledge each other, chatting as the lights change to RED, but in no hurry to move. An impatient woman passenger flicks a look at the passeng in the opposite cab, wanting to share this moment of passenger outrage. We see ALLELINE'S profile staring stonily ahead. We follow his cab as it peels off into a FAMILIAR street, driving towards the house where we met Polyakov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley slips into the water. It's late afternoon. Very still and calm. Very few swimmers. Smiley's head breaks t surface, dips in, breaks the surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley sits on a platform with his back to us, drying off from his swim, looking out over the water. A MAN'S HEAD appears, swimming up to the platform through the reeds. A old QUEEN, his face almost purple with the cold. He cling to the edge of the platform for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in case it's of interest, dear. We are observed. Old Filth in the bushes. Not very subtle but there you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swims away. The wind lifts up a little, rustling the trees and bushes around the pond. We stay on Smiley, watched and alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley walks into his hallway, picks up the MAIL piled on the floor. He crosses to the drawing room, still looking the mail. The door is a little ajar and through the opening we catc a FLASH of movement in the room beyond - a COUPLE in a passionate embrace, glimpsed for a moment before they disappear out of sight. We can hear what may be their lov making. And a RECORD IS PLAYING. The same CHARLIE RICH track Smiley reacted to in the Islay Hotel. Smiley stares at the mail in his hand as if unwilling to look up. He pushes open the door and moves into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... which is EMPTY. He sits in an armchair, starts openin some letters. A FIGURE walks past Smiley abruptly. Smiley doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good flight? Smiley looks up. BILL HAYDON sits in the armchair opposite in shirt and trousers, SOCKS, NO SHOES. He sips a cup of tea. No sense of having been caught in an act of adultery.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON SMILEY
dialogues.text: ... who is now wearing a raincoat and we realise we are i fractured memories of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Pleasant enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just passing, thought I'd call in. Ann was in bed but she insisted on getting up. She said she'll be down in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley glances at a half-wrapped oil painting lying again a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm dropping off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley stands in front of the muddy-looking abstract painting we saw earlier. It's now on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awful daub really but Ann expressed a liking... What's keeping her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold on Smiley but hear Haydon leave the room, a WHISPERED CONFERENCE in the hall between Haydon and Ann. P.O.V. - FROM THE DOOR - George with his back to us, star fixedly at the picture, listening to the whispers behind back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prideaux lies on his bed. There is a tap at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, Roach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roach walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you were in sick bay? What are you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, seeing the anxiety on the boy's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Jumbo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir there's a stranger parked down on the road. He's just sitting there. He dissolves into tears. Prideaux crouches beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright, old fella. Don't cry. Nobody ever watched like you, did they? Off you go, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going to have to leave? Prideaux stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine. You get back to bed. Roach wipes his eyes and leaves. As soon as the door is closed Prideaux crawls under the little chest of drawers, grimacing with pain, working an arm further in... There is a FAINT SOUND - SOMEONE ON THE STEPS OUTSIDE. With a final effort Prideaux rips his RIFLE free from its hiding place, still trailing tape, and rolls to face the door, gun in hand. Silence. Then... A KNOCK AT THE DOOR. Prideaux aims the gun... The door opens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... to reveal Control peering out at us. He steps aside a allows a PRE-INJURY Prideaux to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flat Smiley visited. Control leads Prideaux into the same room - the green armchair, surrounded by mounds of files and papers, over-flowing ashtrays, the detritus of obsession. The FIVE PHOTOGRAPHS of FACES fixed to the CHE PIECES before him. Control, a walking corpse, lowers himself into the armchair, motions Prideaux to take another seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONTROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't followed? Prideaux sits, presuming the question is rhetorical. CONTROL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust no-one, Jim. Especially not in the main stream. What Hungarian identities do you still have running? PRIDEAUX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andras Benedek, Hungarian journalist based in Paris. Control nods thoughtfully. Then... CONTROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're caught, you keep me out of it. You were acting alone, bit of Private Enterprise. Understood? Prideaux watches him, very still. CONTROL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had an offer of service. A Hungarian General. Wants to come over. I want you to meet him. He has information I need, Jim. PRIDEAUX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What information? CONTROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocketry. Ballistics. Bit of politics. Something in his manner alerts Prideaux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else? CONTROL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat) Treasure. He has treasure. The name of the Mole Moscow Centre has planted at the top of the Circus. Prideaux's face doesn't change, but he's wondering if the rumours could be true and Control really has gone mad. CONTROL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a rotten apple Jim and we have to find it. Laboriously he leans forward to the CHESS SET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm   so close I can almost feel his   heart beating. I know it's one   of five men. All I want from you   is one word. He points to the PHOTOGRAPH of PERCY ALLELINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alleline - Tinker. (Points at the next photo) Haydon - Tailor. Bland - Soldier. We drop Sailor, it's too close to Tailor. (Pointing at next photo) Esterhase - Poorman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prideaux sits with his visitor - Smiley -      recalling meeting. He's drinking vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means I was...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were Beggarman. Smiley nods. Just a flicker of the eyes shows us that thi is painful for him to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you make of it, Jim? Control's theory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Stiff)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was madness. To think any one of you could have been a traitor... madness. Smiley is watching him intently - sure he's hiding something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But still you went? Risking your life for a mission you thought was absurd? Why? Prideaux doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps some part of you wanted to know if Control was right? Wanted to know if there was a Mole, who it might be? Prideaux shoots him a dangerous look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Hard) I went because Control asked me to go. It's called doing one's duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prideaux climbs off his train and walks down the platform towards us. He pauses for a moment, drawing a Hungarian newspaper from his pocket. As he does so he glances at th other passengers walking past him. TWO WOMEN and a MAN, a apparently travelling alone, the SHOES they're wearing - BROWN SUEDE BOOTS, FUR LINED BLACK PLASTIC BOOTS and the man - a pair of BLACK GALOSHES. Prideaux walks on, tapping the paper against his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene from the opening of the film. The Waiter puts down Prideaux's plate, a drop of sweat from his forehead hitting the table. He looks at the droplet, fakes a smile for the Magyar, looks after the Waiter, scans the floor around him... HIS P.O.V. - There it is - one of the women is wearing th BLACK PLASTIC BOOTS. Her coat is different and she's wearing a fur hat now - but the shoes are the one thing t surveillance agents don't have time to change. Prideaux glances up at the apartment windows above, sees the old woman, starts to rise... as we CUT TO: The SHOT - ... punching into his back, Prideaux falling forward... a we CUT TO: PRIDEAUX'S P.O.V. Those shoes again, stepping in the water and blood on the floor, passing us at eye-level. Grouping and regrouping a the operation comes to an end. The noise in the backgroun comes to us muted and very faint. Faintly, a baby is crying, an ambulance siren is wailing. Hands appear and we are rolled onto a stretcher and lifte up to chest level where we seem to FLOAT past the faces o the MAGYAR and the other Officers, smoking cigarettes by the doors, and out towards the open doors of a waiting ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are slid into the back of the ambulance as though into the drawers of a morgue. And snap to BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are looking at the back of Prideaux's head, hair damp with sweat, shoulders trembling. We PULL OUT and find Prideaux, a filthy dressing covering the wound on his back. The cell he is in has filthy, heavily padded walls, like a straitjacket. From a speaker in the ceiling comes a maddening jagged drone. Lights bla down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you tell them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prideaux, in too much pain to walk, is being dragged down brightly lit corridor towards an INTERROGATION ROOM at th far end. He is taken inside, the door closed behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley stands staring at the OWL Prideaux killed, which i now stuffed, keeping guard from the top of a bookshelf. Prideaux sits at a desk drinking the vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I held on as long as I could, to give everyone else time to get the hell out of there. (Beat) Did they? Smiley seems to have been thinking about something else, looks at him, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My networks in Hungary. Did they get out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. They were blown. The story is you blew them to save your own skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prideaux nods, makes an odd gesture as if he's about to rise, but doesn't move. His expression hasn't changed, bu inside him something has just been decided. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was your last line of defence? PRIDEAUX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mole. Control's crazy theory. I was going to bury that so deep, they'd never get it out of me. Which was a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? PRIDEAUX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they already knew. They wanted to know how far Control had got in his investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else? PRIDEAUX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Circus gossip. Was Percy's wife still drinking, who was Bland screwing in the office. That sort of thing. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they ask about me at all? PRIDEAUX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of them did. Smiley becomes very still. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he say about me? PRIDEAUX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a cigarette lighter. Kept flashing it round for me to see. Showed me the inscription. "To George, from Ann. All my love." He reckoned after Bill's fling with her, she might want to change the inscription. Smiley doesn't flicker. PRIDEAUX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Still looking to the side) I told him to go to hell. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they had one man like Bill Haydon they could call it set and match!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat, quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was well said. They sit in silence for a moment. Smiley buttons his coat finished here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try and put it all behind you, Jim. He makes to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave me a cigarette. Prideaux looks down at his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim? Prideaux still doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was my last one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A concrete bunker of a room. Prideaux is standing in a sl of watery sunshine that falls from a sky-light above. He' smoking, trying to control the tremble in his hand. PRIDEAUX P.O.V. - The patch of sunshine only extends a fe yards in front of him. The rest of the room is in granite shadow. The sense of other people watching from the shadows. The sound of a door opening and someone being le in. A woman walks across the dark room and into the slab of light, blinking as she does so. It's IRINA. Her hair is loose and dishevelled about her face. A man's voice comes from further back in the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Russian accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know this woman? Prideaux looks at her. Frowns. Another voice murmurs in Russian. Irina pins her hair up in the way we saw before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know her. She looks at Prideaux and gives a small polite smile, as though good manners are going to save her.

dialogues.speaker: I...
dialogues.text: A GUARD steps out of the shadows and SHOOTS her in the head, the shot THUNDEROUS in the room. It's horribly unexpected, and Prideaux jerks backward, bewildered and appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Percy Alleline what we did.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH WINDSCREEN
dialogues.text: ... rain lashes down, obscuring our view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who she was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Cold)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody you need concern yourself with. An unfortunate... REVERSE - we see Guillam and Smiley are sitting in the parked car in the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said when he got out, when he was being debriefed at the Nursery, he had a visitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby Esterhase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Prideaux stands watching a small, dapper figure crossing the grounds towards him - TOBY ESTERHASE. A man who's come up in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave him a thousand pounds. Told him he was dead now and couldn't come back. Had to become a Lotus Eater - forget everything that happened - Control's theory, Tinker, Tailor... all of it. Guillam stares at him, ALERT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that's what I thought. How on earth did Esterhase hear about "Tinker, Tailor?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley gets out of the car, into the rain. Looks around him, uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you watch my back, Peter? Look out for a solo. Just a feeling I've had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, George. I'll watch. Guillam watches as Smiley heads off into the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley stares at the CHESS BOARD - a complex pattern of related figures. He turns back to the tape-deck, puts the headphones on, presses play:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over headphones)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly did Irina say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over headphones)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said there was a General, work-name Polyakov who was stationed in London. And that Polyakov's real job was to service the mole. He meets him regularly and takes back information the Mole gives him for Karla. Smiley presses STOP. He presses RE-WIND, watches the tape spool BACKWARDS. He goes too far, presses FAST-FORWARD, watches the tape REVERSE DIRECTION. And, at this moment, can tell from his expression, a piece of the jig-saw fall into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lacon and Smiley are meeting with the MINISTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This meeting is not taking place. Is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfectly, Minister. (Beat) There is a house, somewhere in this city, where Alleline and the others meet Witchcraft's London representative. I need the address of that house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. Smiley stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know the address. And I fail to see the... I thought Lacon had made it clear to you, keep your nose bloody-well out of Witchcraft's business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Lacon's advice I'm following. (To Lacon) You told me to follow in Control's footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINISTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Snapping) Well, I wouldn't consider that sound advice, after the bloody mess Control left us with. It's taken Alleline - and, if I may say so, myself - this long to get us back into the race. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you take some of the credit. Lacon glances sharply at Smiley - there's something different about him, his tone... SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man Alleline and the others meet is called Polyakov. You believe his role is to bring information from Witchcraft to you. His real role is to receive information from the Mole to take back to Karla. He has the Minister's full attention now. A long silence. MINISTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's... that's not possible. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Made possible. By you. When he steals our secrets he does it under the very nose of the Circus, in the house which you persuaded the treasury to pay for. I'm sure you'll be able to take full credit for that. MINISTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Appalled) Witchcraft's intelligence is genuine! It's been gold! SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just enough glitter, amongst the chicken-feed. Control didn't believe in miracles and he didn't believe in Witchcraft. But you were lazy and you were greedy and so you hounded him out of the Circus and you let Karla in. His voice is still calm, but it's clear what's different now. There's a quiet fury in him. The Minister is ashen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... We can't be made to look like fucking fools again! Forget Europe, if we have the black men getting to hear about this on Walla-Wallah News! What if we find the Mole and we move him sideways, some department where he can't do any harm? Is the Kremlin likely to boast about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in their interests sir. They need the Enemy to look like a threat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, tell them to play the game. We don't go crowing about their fuck-ups! In their panic, both men are addressing each other, momentarily forgetting Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Suddenly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are not the prize. We're the bait. They turn to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've opened negotiations to exchange intelligence with the Americans. What they tell the Circus, they'll be telling the Kremlin. Witchcraft's information, the "gold" Karla let you have? It wasn't to lure you. It was to lure the Americans. Now, do you want to take credit for that? Lacon and the Minister stare at Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have one thing the Mole wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a belligerent Tarr, confidence regained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I want your word you'll get Irina back. Don't care who you have to trade. I want a family. Don't wanna end up like you lot... He looks at Smiley, then he gives Guillam a knowing look, as though deliberately provoking him. Guillam absorbs the slur but his eyes are hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna live in Paris out of your hair. You'll get her back? Again a flash of the coldness in Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do my utmost, Ricki.

dialogues.speaker: ON LIFT DOORS
dialogues.text: The doors open to reveal TOBY ESTERHASE, chatting to a JANITOR. ESTERHASE'S P.O.V. Guillam, standing by his car - holding the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam is driving. The radio is on. The car pulls up on the roadside and two people climb in the back. It's Smile and Fawn. Guillam speeds off. Nobody speaks. Esterhase sits stiff, mind-whirring, uncomfortably aware of Fawn's unsettling presence behind him.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: ... as he stumbles through the muddy airfield. A vast, empty space all around. Toby starts to turn, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep walking please. Toby stumbles on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk about loyalty Toby. Control recruited you when you were trying to escape from Hungary didn't he? A wanted man. Saved you from a KGB bullet, didn't he? And yet, when the time came, when it came to picking sides between him and Alleline, you didn't hesitate? Understandable perhaps, with your war experience. You've survived this long, I suppose, because of your ability to change sides, serve any Master? Faintly we hear the low drone of an approaching engine. Esterhase scans the horizon, locks on the black speck in sky - an aircraft flying towards them. Esterhase watches approach with mounting anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what's this about George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about which Master you've been serving, Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FILE is placed in a briefcase - we can see now that the hands in the frame belong to Esterhase. He checks the corridor is clear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... as he and Guillam drive Esterhase on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intelligence has been leaked, Toby. Someone's been taking files from the Circus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esterhase leaving the Circus, Bryant politely wishing him good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... eyes fixed on the plane as it roars down towards them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a mistake George, this is all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The files were delivered to a Russian attache, weren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Esterhase holding up the documents for Polyakov to photograph. Whir... Click....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And yes, I delivered them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alleline getting out of the cab by the railings... the do barking from inside the house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but so did Percy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haydon walking past Mrs McCraig and heading up the stairs to the empty room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and Bill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roy Bland sits in front of Polyakov, holding up the documents for Polyakov to photograph - Whir... Click....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Roy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Esterhase can't tear his eyes away from the propeller pla descending onto the runway ahead of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things aren't always what they seem. You know that George. Moscow thinks Polyakov's working for them, so, every now and then we give him the odd file to take back to them, just chicken-feed, keep his bosses happy. But Polyakov's our Joe, part of a big operation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operation Witchcraft? Yes, I know. Esterhase stops, turns to look at Smiley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we here? Why are we...? Guillam gives him a sudden VIOLENT SHOVE in the back. Esterhase straightens himself, runs a palm through his hair, real fear on his face now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't... I don't deserve this. I don't deserve this George!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gave you the message for Jim to forget about Tinker Tailor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bland!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get rid of Connie Sachs? Westerby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bland or Haydon. I don't remember. One of them. Maybe Percy. I don't know who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just the messenger? Running between them all. Anything to serve Witchcraft? Esterhase flinches again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know all about your secret source. And I know something you don't. I know who he is.(Beat) He's Karla. Esterhase turns to look at them in horror. Guillam pushes him again. The plane has taxied to a halt ahead of them. Unmarked. Something sinister about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... in the London House, spools turning. We hear the familiar Click... Whir of Polyakov's camera...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polyakov is photographing... nothing. The table in front him is empty, the shooting just a pantomime for the microphone above. As he continues to shoot we see the Mystery man sitting across the table from him. He takes o a canister of developed film and passes it to Polyakov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of you has been giving Polyakov the Crown Jewels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... standing on the airfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know. I swear I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still a wanted man, Toby? Toby looks back at the plane, almost hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You picked the wrong side, Toby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, you've got to believe me. I would never... I'm loyal, George. I'm loyal! Smiley watches him cry for a moment, his face impassive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the address. Where do you meet Polyakov?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A terrace of flat-fronted nineteenth century houses one o them the house we have already visited. A CAR draws up before one of them and Smiley, Fawn and Guillam get out and head for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men are fanning out, Fawn and Guillam heading into th kitchen. Smiley walks upstairs, dogged by the HOUSEKEEPER MRS McCRAIG - not at all happy with the invasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the safety signals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an air duct. Open and all's well. Closed and you're not to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter the EMPTY ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the mike, Mrs McCraig? She points at the candelabra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's the procedure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever the gentlemen are meeting I record the session. The tapes are sent back to the Circus. From downstairs come the crash of furniture being moved, rooms searched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing? They shouldn't be moving things! The authority in Smiley's voice stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're at all worried you can call Lacon from the basement phone. Let's try the tape recorder shall we?

dialogues.speaker: TAPE RECORDER
dialogues.text: Over the RECORDER we can hear GUILLAM'S VOICE reciting something from childhood, from the room above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy stood on the burning deck whence all but he had fled. The flame that lit the battles wreck, shone round him o'er the dead... Smiley is listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yet beautiful and bright he stood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of a street in Paris. A squat Yorkshireman - MACKELVORE - walks out of a nearby restaurant and gets into a car. Out of nowhere Tarr suddenly appears, climbing into the passenger side, ramming a gun into his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mackelvore leads Tarr into a grand but dilapidated apartment. An elderly FRENCHMAN - ex-Resistance - looks u from his evening meal as the two pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guest from London Station, Monsieur Fourcade. The Frenchman grunts a greeting, turns back to his supper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they walk on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole service is looking for you, Ricki. They'll skin you alive if they find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mildly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I want them to find me. Mackelvore frowns. They reach a door which he opens to reveal a STEEL DOOR beyond. He presses a bell and a hatch in the door slides open and a young man's face appears. This is BEN. He slides open a bolt, a double lock, and le them into a ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go home now, Ben. Leave the books where they are and put the keys into the machines. I'll be talking to London presently under my own steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay boss. Tarr takes out his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Flat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben stays here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
