dialogues.text: Tarr stands over Mackelvore, who is sending a message to the Circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dictating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ricki Tarr claims to have further information vital to the safeguarding of the Circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark workroom. WE TRACK through a crowd of TAILORS DUMMIES. Some of the dummies are draped in clothes, some just shap in the darkness. As though we are moving through A ROOM FULL OF SPIES. By a great domed window, occasionally washed with yellow from the traffic outside, we find MENDEL, his back to us staring out.

dialogues.speaker: THE CIRCUS ACROSS THE ROAD.
dialogues.text: A taxi pulls up a few yards away from the circus doors. W see a man clamber out. It's Percy Alleline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tinker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley sits on an armchair, lit by a harsh over-head ligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy. Smiley puts the receiver on the arm of the chair, takes o his shoes and in his stocking feet crosses the room. As h does so he spools out a WASHING LINE, tying it to the far door knob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam, waits on the tow-path looking back at the house. Someone, presumably Smiley, is moving through the house, turning the lights off until it is in complete darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tailor... A torch light flashes once from a downstairs window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes Soldier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley sits in the darkness holding the phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men stand over the silent cypher machine. Tarr' gun rammed into his belt. Tarr is almost glittering with nerves. Then the machine clatters into life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read it aloud. Ben starts to read, his high, rather imperious schoolboy voice carries over the next few shots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personal for Tarr from Alleline...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shot of the archive room, of the lift full of secrets slowly being lowered into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... require clarification before meeting your request... ON THE DOOR OF THE WAR-ROOM resolutely closed, a slither light burning beneath it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tailors dummies standing to attention, as alert as Mendel watching from the window, phone to mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Quote information vital to safeguarding of the Circus unquote does not qualify...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarr has begun to laugh, gripped by a weird hilarity. reads even faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... send further information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way Percy boy! You keep stalling. I better warn you Ben, there's some lousy people in this outfit. Don't trust a fucking one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley sits in the BLACKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The washing line extends ahead of him, glowing faintly white in the darkness. The tinny sound of Mendel's voice comes from the receiver beside him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Smiley... Smiley picks up the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, Mendel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One's gone. Smiley puts the receiver back on the armchair. He goes to the window in his stockinged feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam, nerves taut, sees three long flashes. The mole i coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silent look at the dark house. Then the star of light spilling into the darkness from the air vent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley, calm and contained, hears the sound of a CAB drawing up outside. A pair of footsteps on the path. Scrape of a key in the door. A pale rim of light appears around the kitchen door. And outside the sound of a second cab drawing up. Someone else enters the house. Movement in the kitchen. T men's voices start to speak in Russian. Smiley gets up, GUN in one hand, and guided by the line, makes his way through the darkness to the door of the kitchen, groping, rather like a blind man walking towards the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your cover story in case we are disturbed? The sound of ANOTHER voice answering in Russian from further back in the room. ON Smiley inching across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape recorder working...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on tape, in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can be salvaged. Tarr can be found and liquidated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillam waits. He turns, his nerves taut, searching the shadows for movement. For a moment he's certain he's bein WATCHED. Then, from the house, the signal he's been waiting for. Three long flashes. Guillam starts to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nervous Lacon is waiting on a corner, Guillam runs past

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't have bloodshed. I want absolute calm! A cab appears and Mendel jumps out. Mendel and Lacon hurr towards the house, Guillam sprinting ahead.

dialogues.speaker: THE TAPE SPOOL
dialogues.text: ... churning the SILENCE. The sounds of the house amplified. No one talking. Perhaps the faintest of coughs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racing towards the FRONT DOOR and bursting through, into the hallway and on up the stairs, taking them three at a time, bursting through into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An oddly formal scene. POLYAKOV stands pipe in hand. Smiley sits in a chair, GUN in hand. Absurdly, still in h STOCKING FEET. And opposite him sits BILL HAYDON. They all turn to look at Guillam who stands panting in th doorway.

dialogues.speaker: ON GUILLAM
dialogues.text: ... as his nerves and excitement and any hope he might ha had of a sense of victory DRAINS AWAY, leaving him with just an odd sense of embarrassment and shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nissan huts surround a cricket field. Two cadets run laps Smiley walks towards one of the huts, stops as Alleline walks out. Alleline, a broken man, can barely look at him With a nod he walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unshaven, exhausted Haydon stands outside the Sarratt building in a small fenced enclosure. We see Smiley walki towards him. He's brought a box of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haydon is weeping quietly but without emotion. Smiley offers Haydon the box of Cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was assured there would be no coercion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haydon waves it away. Smiley hands him a clean handkerchi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL HAYDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost funny George. I know the Inquisitors little bag of tricks. I taught most of them. Don't mind the tears. Just a reaction. An over-reaction, if you like. Craddox says I'll be off in a few days. I keep thinking how I'm going to miss the cricket in Moscow. He weeps again. BILL HAYDON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rather hoped you would do a little light house-keeping for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I can. BILL HAYDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a girl...Would you give her some money for me? Give her a good cover story. If it helps tell her I love her. It's all here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. BILL HAYDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a boy too. Bung him a few quid to shut him up. Take it out of the reptile fund. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did have one or two questions. About Prideaux. BILL HAYDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! I got him back, didn't

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes you did. That was good of you. (Beat) I'm surprised Karla didn't shoot him. Or do you think he held back out of delicacy towards you? No response. Smiley looks carefully at Haydon's profile. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Prideaux come and see you before he left on his Hungarian mission? BILL HAYDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, as a matter of fact he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To say what? Haydon stares at him. For the first time the tears seem real. Guilt and grief. He looks down. A long pause. SMILEY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) To warn you. Because he knew, deep down, it was you all along. BILL HAYDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did you. Haydon stares out, lost in thought. BILL HAYDON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to pick a side George. It was an aesthetic choice as much as a moral one. The West has grown so very ugly, don't you think? Smiley doesn't answer. A moment of silence. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Karla ever consider having you take over the Circus? For a moment Haydon looks rattled. BILL HAYDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not his bloody office boy. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you then? Haydon turns to Smiley, a flash of hauteur. BILL HAYDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm someone who made his mark. Smiley watches him, feeling him shrink in stature before eyes. Haydon lights a cigarette. SMILEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly) Is there anything you want me to pass on to Ann? For a moment Haydon looks genuinely puzzled. BILL HAYDON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that was nothing personal, George, I hope you understand that? Karla said you were good, the one we had to worry about. But you do have a blind spot. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reckoned if I was known to be Ann's lover you wouldn't be able to see me straight. And he was right, up to a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up to a point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flat is now empty, cleared of Control's possessions. Smiley looks around, places a CHESS PIECE on the piano. W see the piece bears the name HAYDON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Tailor." He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George comes up his path, looking old and tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops still inside his doorway. The little figure on t console table is in the wrong position. Smiley puts his hand on it, but doesn't right it, listening to something from somewhere inside the house. A faint movement. Through the HALF OPEN KITCHEN DOOR we catch a glimpse of WOMAN beyond. ANN is back. Smiley stands with his back to us, still in his coat, staring through the door at his wife beyond. Something of Vermeer in the image. He's absorbing the different atmosphere - home. Deciding whether to go in. Or not. Suddenly we hear MUSIC - JULIO IGLESIAS, singing a disco version of LA MER - very seventies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same lively Christmas PARTY at the Circus we saw earlier. BILL HAYDON, a little drunk and happy, works his way through the packed room, dancing to the Iglesias' track, a drink in each hand, a little tongue-in-cheek, singing along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... other members of the Circus glimpsed as we pass them CONNIE SACHS, WESTERBY, BLAND, drunk, grinning at us. TOB ESTERHASE talking to one of the SECRETARIES... The MUSIC continues as we find... CONTROL and SMILEY ...sitting a little apart, talking. Haydon is still worki his way through the party... We PASS PERCY ALLELINE and his DRUNK WIFE. Alleline looki fretful and hoping no-one is noticing the scene she is making... Haydon grins at all his comrades, feeling fond of everyon but heads on to his destination... PRIDEAUX sits watching him come with a drink towards him, shakes his head, but can't help but smile fondly at the i Haydon is prepared to make of himself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music continues as we see two cadets are running on t circuit, their white t-shirts only just visible in the dark. Haydon sits on his bench, smoking, watching them flit by. He smiles to himself, remembering. He senses something, turns and looks back. Prideaux stands in the shadows behi him, some fifteen foot away. The two men stare at each other, then Haydon turns back to watch the runners. We HOLD CLOSE on his face as Prideaux approaches, the onl sound the soft wind and his hushed footsteps growing lose Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Of the runners) Just like us Jim. (Beat) Best days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rifle is placed on the side of his head - the same execution shot that we saw used on Irina - the force blowing him sideways out of the frame. As the music continues we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frost on the grass. We find a CADET staring down at the corpse of Haydon leaning against the back of the bench, outlined in silver frost. The music ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prideaux sits on his bed. From outside - the sound of a football game. Someone taps on the door. Low. Taps again. Prideaux, coiled with grief and anger, suddenly gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roach stands in the doorway, carrying a gift - a boot- scrape made in woodwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prideaux stares at the boot scrape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you hanging around here. Keep away from me from now on. Go and join the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roach stands frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just bloody join in. Go and play damn you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches Roach walk to the edge of the field and stand mutely at the side. A ball rolls towards him. Roach goes kick it. Misses. He tries again, RUNNING OUT OF SHOT. 257aA   EXT. PARIS DEPARTMENT STORE - EVENING Tarr is walking through a busy street. He stops to light cigarette. A woman in a YELLOW dress appears, reflected i the glass. She's holding the hands of two children. For a moment it looks like Irina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarr spins round, but the woman has disappeared. He stare after her, hoping to catch a glimpse of her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley walks back into the lobby, hesitates for a moment, then pushes on through the turnstile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George takes his place at the baronial chair. He examines the CHESS PIECE in his hand. We see it is labelled KARLA. He toys with it for a moment, then places it on the table in front of him, clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shall we begin? Through the open door Smiley's new inner circle begin to enter and take their place at the table around him.
